OxrLCHmQsc9JsmZgpVMrlg.text: Bagels that rival the ones in LA and NYC.  Only a few blocks east of the Strip.  Places like this are a vanishing breed; see the 2014 movie Deli Man.  Bagels are crusty on the outside and thick and chewy on the inside.  Standard selection of onion, poppy, salt, sesame, pumpernickel, etc.  Bialys too.    I had mine with cream cheese and sliced tomato, and they were perfect.    My kids had the omelette and bagelwich, both of which were generous.  Sandwiches later were good too.  Other baked goods were great, particularly the mini challah and the chocolate chip mandelbot.  Staff was friendly.  Will have to return.

5Ic9zuM43kaiEPZbLA4aCA.text: great breakfast! spot   especially if you in a rush  this spot worked out perfect for my employees and i before our convention

p5tvR4xs-Wwb5TyznmbM9A.text: Every year I come to Vegas for a convention and eat at this great little restaurant. It is off the beaten path but well worth it for value & price. I order their special for $7+ gets you 3 eggs, 3 pieces of meat, potatoes & bagel & cream cheese. Their bagels are legit and many choices. They are the real deal.

ABA-J_gpzX9lmmr7TR9G8A.text: Jewels in the rough! It's in a run down plaza that I wouldn't think of stopping on Twain but first time I was there I ran into former Mayor Oscar Goodman to stop here for lunch! The bagel and cream cheese are delicious esp the lox cream cheese! I've been recommending people in my office (Hughes Center) to grab lunch there! And! They have pastrami as well! Not as good as Katz in NYC but it's probably as good as you can get in Vegas.

P0oChqlbcPl0kLEvzCe0sg.text: Being from New York it is difficult to find quality bagels on the west coast...HARRIES does it right.  Everything bagel with egg .... mmmmm 10 out of 10!!!  Great staff. Great food

QmWWZtBkD8cc6qTxD6ws9Q.text: Holy Moly! I ordered through Uber Eats and I'm so glad I did! I got a dozen bagels with the two cream cheese. The apple cinnamon spread is sooo good. I will be getting bagels for the office from Harrie's from now on.

zZgVdph9Q3ZF5Z-Qqone6A.text: We come here for breakfast every time we're in Vegas. Really cute family-owned restaurant. The food is always good. I like that it's a bit outdated, it reminds me of the 90's.

xPKs6owo4mcY3gpwTDqSVQ.text: Based on service only as we were seated at a crammed filthy table with the place being less than half full. Noone took our order or even gave us a menu or high chair for our baby as we asked for, for about 20 min. Two tables that came in after us already  had thier food. So we walked out. Being from Brooklyn we miss bagels and if  we were served I'm sure we would have been regulars. They may be trying to be as stereotypical New Yorkers but it wasn't working.

xZ_fADQ1unGbWbRof7RGpQ.text: This was a great find! We had half a sandwich and soup option. It was probably the matzo ball soup I have ever had, the bagels were delightful and the pastrami was good - maybe a little to fatty,  but good nonetheless. I did order the potato pancake and they were a little different than what I'm used to but it was very good. The texture of the pancake was not shredded potato, but more like mashed. I would still order it again. It is a great place for breakfast or lunch if you're near the convention center.

RByjpnsDkM53vTx83qmXaw.text: Underrated gem.  Great food, friendly people.  Best deli food I've had in Las Vegas - better than the bigger names on the strip.  Lox is fantastic.  Bagels fresh and New York style.  Don't let the sketchy neighborhood stop you.  Worth the trip from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homey place

tNCTh54m_Rv8Qg8J62fnng.text: Great bagels.  Great sandwiches.  Real deli food.  Potato pancake was also awesome.  Have nothing bad to say about this place.  The fact that it's in a kind of run down "non-Vegas" part of Vegas is a plus for me.  Less than 5 minutes from the strip.  Reasonable prices.

p5axY-747wwONhkb25qZGw.text: Bagels are pretty good.   Have gotten some sandwiches and traditional Jewish dishes- potato pancakes blintzes and knish.   Everything is pretty good.  Wouldn't say great.  They are heavy handed on the onions.   Coffee is pretty bad.    It's getting 4 stars because the inside is pretty yuck like the area.  Time for a remodel.  I'd be scared to use the bathroom inside.  At least now they take credit cards.

kADwKVMxwwQKA9zrX13PQQ.text: Delicious! Even the plain cream cheese is special!  Friendly service and the owner is fabulous to

aMpasEgKe1NTOcZyde2Xxg.text: Sometimes you get a craving for something...for me it was lox and bagels on an everything bagel with capers. And nothing else will do. Yeah, I could have went to Einstein Bagels...and had some teenager slap something together for me. I didn't want that, I wanted a good bagel place, locally owned, and that knows how to make great bagels. I found what I was looking for at Harrie's Bagelmania.   Yes, it's in a "sketchy" part of town for some people. So what. Walk in, have a seat, and let them bring you a menu. Service was spot on...I had questions, I got answers without attitude. My food arrived fast. My check didn't arrive until I was just about finished. I like service like that which I consider just right.   But all that means nothing, what about the food? I had another one of those OMG did I order more than I can eat moments? That bagel was stacked! And it was kinda messy too (which is good and that's NOT a complaint!). And while I thought $1 extra for the capers was a bit pricey....they loaded my bagel up!  Decor wise the place could use a slight facelift, but to be honest I was too busy chowing down to give a dang about decor. They are a bit pricey for my typical lunch and way over the top on calorie counts but if you gotta have lox and bagels, Harrie's Bagelmania has what you need. I will be back!   (Bookmarked for months....boy am I glad I finally got over there to check it out. Oh and they take credit / debit cards...no ancient ATM in sight as mentioned by earlier reviewers, but I brought cash just in case.)  (Yelp 100 in 2013 Challenge #2)

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lox and bagel!

QqCUjJCgYNkTP8nT0pZICw.text: I got their generic breakfast that comes with potatoes, two eggs, and a bagel. I got the salt bagel and it came toasted but it was a little too toasted. The potatoes were the best part of my meal because they were real and seasoned perfect. The eggs were over easy but were a little too on the easy side.. I would say they know how to make bagels the right way here but I should have just gotten a bagel breakfast sandwich instead. Not sure if I will come back here again, wasn't anything I was super crazy about.

41w1L9TpBLK22FaJhpIzPA.text: Made a stop in Vegas for work and wanted a mom n' pops location for breakfast. Just what we were looking for! Great service. Great food. Large parking lot. We ordered the bagel and lox and they let you taste the salted and non salted lox. The non salted lox already is salted so if you want to be healthy, you won't be cutting back on the taste by selecting "non-salted." The bagel is claimed to resemble NY style. Though I still think NY bagels are the best, this wasn't off by too far.  We also got the fresh squeezed OJ and it was perfect! I love pulp and they had a good about of pulp in each sip! I would definitely come back again next time I'm in town! Thank you, Harrie Jr.!

aAjVMljI1asVk9RHW9V9Vg.text: We love Harrie's, when we are on the eastside we will frequent Harrie's. Just plain old fashioned no frills good food. Everything on the menu is excellent.

rfHNJHOsZ30ZKvKt8Reuwg.text: BEST BAGELS IN VEGAS.   This is the only bagel place I've found with fresh salted bagels. If you haven't tried them, you need to! The breakfast specials are amazing. Great eggs, a bagel with fresh cream cheese (nothing philly about it!), bacon, and home fries for a great value. I like to add a side of fruit too.  Be sure to get there early Sunday mornings; the bagels fly out of the bins! Try the bagel sandwiches: salted bagel, fresh eggs, bacon, and cheddar--my boyfriend always wakes right up when I bring these home.   Lox? Incredible. Cookies? Fantastic. Service? Unbeatable. I forgot my wallet once and offered to leave my phone as collateral while I drove home. The cashier was so sweet. She told me she couldn't let me drive without a phone for emergencies. Be sweet to these people. Trust me, we want them to stick around!   Now they're able to accept credit cards, even though the bagels have always been worth carrying cash for.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bagel sandwich: salted bagel, fresh REAL eggs, bacon, and cheddar

sSjerfPonIbEGJnfc4ZRqA.text: Ordered food through uber eats. Received very burnt bagels and asked for a bagel not toasted with cream cheese on the side but received a bagel toasted with cream cheese on it. Gave them a second chance, very disappointed

cFX8MjruuETpCo6r1_TWlg.text: Had breakfast at Harrie's on a Saturday.  It was before 9 AM, and there was only one other table seated when I walked in.  After I ordered, people kept trickling in until the place was nearly half full.  It's in a not so great part of town, and it only takes cash, but these are not reasons to skip Harrie's.  They have a large menu with all of your east coast deli favorites, made on the premises.  I had the Hoppel Poppel, which, and there is no other way to put this, is an enormous amount of food.  It's home fries with eggs, peppers, onions and salami into a glorious scramble that easily covers the whole plate and could probably cover another one.  It comes with your choice of bagel.  I got an everything bagel toasted, and it comes with a lot of cream cheese.  I didn't finish either my scramble or the cream cheese.  The Hoppel Poppel is good, but when you put some Cholula on it, it becomes great.  The potatoes I don't think were seasoned, but the peppers and salami add a lot.  Also, the salami is fantastic, not greasy at all.  I guess if I have a criticism of this dish, it's the lack of seasoning.  But, adding hot sauce really worked.  I got the wife corned beef with eggs to go.  Her potatoes were not seasoned, but they were cooked well.  Not surprisingly, the order of eggs with corned beef was massive.  Yet another breakfast we couldn't finish.    Service was fantastic, the check was brought out quickly as was my to go order.  Friendly people and a comfortable atmosphere.  Can't wait to return to get a huge sandwich for lunch.

sM_BVY8dbbPGHEjh0Zp88g.text: I used to go here all the time. I am not going back ever again. They did not have coffee. Place is gross. Took forever to get menu's, took forever to get a soda. It was so slow. The 2 girls and some guy were more interested in talking to each-other. The cook was laughing bc the food would just sit up there and they were so slow in taking food to tables. There were only 6 tables. The guy gave my wife syrup, and said if u need more let me know.  No one ever came back to check on us so we couldn't get more soda or syrup. What a disaster. It took us over am hour. That place used to be in and out in 25 mins. Place sux

JFFQSouUfMawAVFqWB6seA.text: Incredibly fresh and delicious food!!! Ok, it's not in the best area of town, but nonetheless it IS Zagat-rated. And it's convenient, even to visitors. It's on Twain, the road that runs between Wynn/Encore and Venetian/Palazzo, and it's not too far from them, maybe about a mile to the east.   Just yesterday, I had two of the most delicious everything bagels, toasted, covered on top with crispy onions. And I had them with jalapeno cream cheese. There was so much yummy cream cheese, dripping out all sides, that I had to finish the cream cheese up off the plate using a fork.  And for this prices were very reasonable, about $3.25 per bagel with cream cheese.  The menu is quite reminiscent of a NY Jewish deli. In the past I've had pastrami sandwiches, chicken salad sandwiches, tuna fish on bagel, corned beef sandwiches, potato salad, cheesecake. All delish. And you can take deli meats home by the pound or bagels home by the dozen. The current Tuesday special is, I believe, a dozen bagels to-go for about $6.50.  This is semi-old-school Vegas. It's been in place since 1992 when the original & former owner Mort moved it here from a ritzy suburb of Chicago.   Open at 6:30am and closed by 3pm most days. Authentic, incredibly delicious and very fair prices. If you are anywhere near, try it out!

MQWfCoMMwg-ZqOLchHA8dA.text: I and my wife are extremely happy that  the new owner has not changed any of Charo's recepies. We stopped in to have his fabulous chopped liver . What can we say. It was wonderful as usual. PS... Our bagels were great also.

g8wJTFV-8VSH1AVGbdi2IA.text: I literally wasn't expecting much from this place. I had open thoughts and went in with a smile. I'm glad I did. Very quaint, mom and pop-like restaurant. We were treated and seated happily along with experiencing a tranquil surrounding. Our waitress was personable and pleasant, very patient. Refills were spot-on. Our food came out within a decent amount of time. Potatoes were different but tasty (a wee bit burnt, but we just removed that part). The meat was good...we had the ham and bacon. All a bit "crispier" than what we normally have but not overbearing. The bagels...WHEW!! Apparently what they are known for!! They were phenomenal!! Delightful cream cheese on the side and amazing at that. Bagels were full of yummy!! All in all, the prices are reasonable, the location is ehhh but the food is worth it and sensational!!

nwzbmJXW0KkRzMyiwWXfCw.text: We've been coming here for 13 years and I didn't realize we had not been here since Dec.  Went to pick up some brisket for the holiday last week and found out under new ownership. Was told food was the same.  It was Not! Unfortunately for us I didn't open the brisket until the next night to eat only to find it about 75% fat and looked/ smelled old.  Threw it out.  If they were open at the time I opened it I would have brought/ given it back!  It was always consistent whenever we bought before.  Got a couple of other things and not very good. Will NEVER go back.  For bagels, never loved theirs.  Bagel Cafe other side of town the best  very good. Even prefer Smiths bagels to theirs.

yZdDcEedZD5l-NLLvKZvKQ.text: This place used to be great under the previous ownership.  Sad to say it has changed hands and has gone downhill . It's filthy and they are trying to figure out how to make a chefs salad and chicken soup with no chicken ! Go to bagel cafe instead . It's a 15 minute Drive at the most ! Great amazing deli food ! Buh-bye Bagelmania

teDBiZT6o6yMBQEa_hf7lw.text: Wanted something off the strip. Bagels were great and the price was great as well! Former New Yorker recommended. You will be very happy easy to get to and plenty of parking.

cvrbODtuH3fsgxZMen-jUA.text: Much like the Bagel Cafe on the west side of town, Harrie's serves bagels and deli classics in an old-school diner-style setting. Portions are generous and good-quality product results in surprisingly high prices: my bagel sandwich with lox set me back an absurd $15. I will say that it was loaded with a lot of lox, but maybe normal portions and prices would be more appealing... Other than that, the bagel itself was underwhelming, toasted to a hardness that was difficult to bite into, and just wasn't particularly flavorful aside from the toppings.  Bagels are available in individually or in bulk, toasted or not, with or without schmear and other toppings. Shop only offers choices of regular or scallion cream cheese. Potato pancakes, knishes, blintezes, and other Jewish deli staples available as well as meats by the pound. I still prefer BC, but this isn't a bad option if you're on this side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super thick
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $15 lox bagel sandwich

KwesE0YdlbQpcU885rJJVg.text: I believe this place has changed ownership. It was called (Harry's Bagelmania) I think. The woman who ran the place would always have fresh bagels no matter what time of day. I have now been there three times since and will never go again. Three straight times around 11:30 am they are either out have limited selection available of bagels. This would never have happened under previous ownership. As a New Yorker this was the one place that I could get a bagel similar to the Deli's on Long Island. The one breakfast sandwich I had the bagel was stale. A real shame.

NUcXqoluYYrbie7FsSB5qA.text: Great local bagel spot in Las Vegas. If you have access to a car and are looking to get some local jewish deli breakfast, I highly recommned Bagelmania.  Highlights: - Bagels extremely cheap compared to one the Strip prices - High quality bagels and sandwiches - Friendly service - Parking is in a strip mall - Locals eat here  Overall, this is a great place to get a bagel and coffee to start the day at an affordable price.

FoeJMMUBkLFjLjDYnIFWdA.text: Stopped by for takeout a few weeks ago.....two ham and cheese bagel sandwiches, macaroni salad and chicken soup. Took 30 minutes to get food and over $40.00!. Everything was stale and old tasting; the bagels, the meat, the macaroni salad and soup were all "off".  The chicken soup was clearly just thrown together while I waited. While driving home I could clearly smell the food didn't smell right. EVERYTHING was thrown in the garbage. When I went to write this review just a few days after my visit I saw on Yelp that this place closed down so I didn't write a review but now see its open again?!?   I'll never return.

o7avD_bXzimOqajh5wgesg.text: Food was good but service today was horrible. Only 1 cook, 1 server and one busboy. Waited 45 minutes for food.

C-ASI9xxQcS8zIbQHz1WPg.text: This is a great spot in Vegas for a quick meal.  Lunch is great and breakfast is even better.  Love the salt bagel!  If your in Vegas get off the strip and make a stop over to Bagelmania.

MJR08PGYXjMrOqujHE02ow.text: I haven't walked out of a lot of restaurants without ordering but we did here today. We've been here before and had a good experience but today was ridiculous. Asked for a highchair for our son, didn't get it, got it ourselves. Ordered coffee, did not get it, waitress came back to take our food order and had no clue that she had never gotten the drinks. Asked for a milk for my son, and then she wandered off and came back with just the milk, no coffee. We asked again for the coffee and she wandered off again and brought back the wrong drinks. It was like the waitress had no idea where she was or what was happening. The only other time I have seen someone so out of it was when they were high. We left because we were clearly never going to get any food. Completely ridiculous.

1cnG7OorillfC6VPI8Hw_g.text: Had to walk out no service, place dirty lack help. New management no good . Never go back

u66lgJsD67jIG1_mBT1MRw.text: Hit this little shop, really more of a deli/diner than a straight bagel shop. I had amazing matzo ball soup and an ok sandwich. Coffee was fabulous. I will be back next time i go through town.

2fSAtwk52ev-JH2UuOsYQw.text: Bagel choices were plentiful. Nice texture and flavor. Very generous with the eggs. I believe our waitress just started this week. Very friendly. Coffee was only downside. Need flavor creams??

pSuklRg3TNUNl4uPKDSFEg.text: I wanted to love Harrie's Bagelmania. I didn't! There is a scarcity of New York style bagel shops in Las Vegas. The only three that I know of are Bagel Cafe (Summerlin), NY Bagels (downtown), and Harrie's Bagelmania.    Harrie's Bagelmania is in an economically challenged neighborhood. I was surprised to see the exorbitant prices that are disproportionate to the average income of the area and the highest prices that I have seen a bagel restaurant charge. Nearly $15 for a bagel with lox Sandwich!? Your kidding Me! Nearly $9 for a bagel with egg salad! This is before paying for a beverage.     I opted for the bagelwich with a fried egg and ham. This is one of the reasonable priced items on their menu. Interestingly the only style of egg listed was fried. What about scrambled?  I wasn't too crazy about the bagelwich. When I taste a bagel, my expectation is that it is hot and soft. This bagelwich fell short of my expectation. The ham was okay. As far as the coffee it was also okay.     I was satisfied with the service. The waitress was on top of my coffee refills at the same that she was pleasant. When I paid the cashier joked over the  change being an unlucky number. I easily rectified that when I left the waitress a tip for good service.     I don't love Harrie's Bagelmania. To be honest I left disappointed with the exorbitant pricing and bagelwich that fell short of my expectations yet satisfied with the service. My Harrie's Bagelmania check-ins stop here.
