tjWyIOkyOri8ansR5q3F0Q.text: On very visit to Las Vegas we stop at Harrie's Bagelmania. The deli takes you back to the old time delicatessen with True deli food. The menu is filled with True Jewish food items. This is a local restaurant to get you away from the strip if you are a visitor. You will not go wrong.

EnbI21KvcnooEy9Fl_t5tg.text: Been coming here for years love the corned beef sandwich beats every other place in town.   Also the service has always been spot on. I try to make here as often as possible. If you go on Tuesdays they have their specials going on.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bagels in town!!!

irl1wNxkFCydTrASWxA-dw.text: Loved this restaurant! The bagels were delicious; the meat knish was phenomenal; and, the service was very warm and attentive. I gave four stars instead of five because they do not have a credit card machine and I had to use their ATM machine in order to pay my bill. However, that did not take away from the quality of the food or service at Harrie's. Will definitely eat here again the next time I am in Las Vegas!

kXOzSZ-v2Rp7p7dHMnvV2w.text: Yay! I'm MOST DEFINITELY a fan.   Sadly, I have never heard of this place, nor been to this place. However, I did have these delicious bagels brought into my life when they were delivered to me at work.   I got a dozen of my favorite: Everything Bagel! I have never had a better everything bagel!!! I am no expert or aficionado of bagels, but I was blown away. Aside from the taste and the abundance of garlic, onions, poppy seeds galor.... the texture was also perfect. The top half of the bagel was loaded and dense/fluffy... while the bottom was denser and had a nice bite to it.   I can't wait to make a presence in this said to be authentic bagel shop so I can see what all they have to offer and re-write my review!   Right now I am about to try the cinnamon bagel... and I'm excited:]

Kz4D4BypL1r1EsHSFB3mlg.text: Had a late breakfast here, and I've got to say I'm a fan now. The Reuben Omelet is absolutely amazing! The fact that it's not in one of the nicest places in town shouldn't deter you from giving this hidden gem a shoit.

dEk-5wOkiN5_hKfP8zKwKg.text: Classic New York-style bagel place nestled in the heart of the ghetto on Twain Street. (take your gat with you!)  We order breakfast from here, for my work, when we have large meetings.  Everyone always requests this place and we order the simplest thing:  -Bagel Breakfast Sandwich: egg, cheese (some sort of meat: bacon, sausage or ham) on a plain bagel.  That is it!  The eggs is cooked perfectly: like a fried egg and the yolk is just barely runny so all the flavors of the egg, cheese, meat and bagel dance on your tongue.  YUM!  Believe this: this sandwich is even good COLD!  We had lots of leftovers and people were eating them for lunch cold.  Cold egg?  Uh yeah, its good on this sandwich.  (I would NEVER eat a Egg McMuffin cold, but this shiz is for real!)  Their bagels are exactly what I look for in a bagel: moist, a little chewy and delicious flavor.  I have only had the plain bagel and if its that good, I can only imagine how good everything else is.  (after i ate two halves: one for breakfast and one for lunch, I gained 2 pounds, but I think it was worth it!!)  Nancy (who I think is married to the owner??) is a doll and always makes sure everything is perfect.  We ordered from here last week: 30 bagel sandwiches and a fruit bowl.  They cut the bagel sandwiches in half and I swear everyone ate at least 3 halves!  The total was around $193 (included tax and delivery) and she took a check.  Now this is hearsay, but a lot of the people in my office have come here for breakfast and have said how they INHALED all of their food, because its that good!  If anything, go here for a bagel breakfast sandwich or bagel and cream cheese and you will be addicted!

mIM_KB-yYDwEuFaaaD_rXw.text: It is what it is. It is not fancy. They don't serve health food. It is a classic. The service can be quite terrible, and they don't accept credit cards. Cash only! However, they have an ATM machine from the 80s. It is the weirdest thing. It doesn't give you cash. It gives you a receipt, and then you give the receipt to the server who brings you your money.   The bagels are a little small but wonderfully and perfectly chewy. On this past visit, I went with a bagelwhich on an everything bagel. I decided not to get it toasted because everything bagels sometimes turn bitter if they're over toasted. It was a strong call, as the bagel was perfect untoasted. I actually went with ham, and the ham was a nice, thick country ham like I grew up on in Georgia. (Well, maybe it had a little less salt.) For $3.95 (which my friend had to pay for because I was without cash!), it is a solid breakfast.  I haven't tried lunch here, but I would say the breakfast is pretty standard fare. You don't go to Harrie's for trendy morning bites. You go here for breakfast with some Vegas oldtimers. Don't forget your cash.

GnyCPwfCLDvFlPgNjBDyAQ.text: I love it, my first time here was great, my family and I are from California,  we came down to visit family and they told us about this place. Well we alll love it, my kids had pancakes and cereal, I had a wonderful Turkey bagel, my husband had a delicious bagel to. I recommend this place (:

2gm-cjkig7QcSKxOV-OO7g.text: This Jewish deli is in a strip mall a few blocks drive from the Strip.  They have tasty breakfasts at a far more reasonable price than the Strip.  The bagels are great.  I wasn't a fan of their smoked whitefish salad, but it was definitely smoked and came in a huge portion.

3y6bpcMHwuoKw3dYZUmq8g.text: This place filled the desire for an authentic Jewish/New York deli. Meyer Lansky would have been proud . The lox was fresh and amazing and the chive cream cheese was for me new and delicious . The bagels fresh and flavorful . The potato pancakes were cooked just right and the Ruben exquisite .

W2U2E85irc9HxqTUFHnJ3A.text: I was told about this place from a man on a cruise ship last winter.  I FINALLY stopped in, even though it's just around the corner from work!  The bagel was great and the amount of Lox they put on is YUM!  I'm looking forward to going there again.

y1ozXMZFkGrYuYa2FvgYxA.text: I came in and got two bagels on my lunch hour. They were nice and efficient and the bagels were nice and chewy. It is a good Jewish deli and I saw many "old school" Vegas types enjoying their breakfast. It is a True hole in the wall, so don't expect linen table clothes but the bagels and cream cheese were good and I saw lots of tempting things in the deli case which will make me come back. The area it is in is a bit sketch so just take note of that:)

FkxArX-Thsg3gBXRpzt6FQ.text: Amazing food.  Im from the east coast living in Arizona.  Went to vegas and found this gem!  They are from Chicago so you know their deli food is good!

UF2hr7YgkLDPy997pWk8BA.text: Love love love this place! I came for the first time last month, and I've been here 4 times since! I l've only had a bagel sandwich but it's wonderful! Thinking about heading over to day, and try some of their other items.

DRPx9skBgR7moghFcxszEg.text: They have Yelp & Zagat rating stickers on the window, which can be intimidating for anyone, walking into a business. I was recommended to come here from a writer in Las Vegas. I ordered the Matzoball soup & Turkey Club with potato pancake and apple sauce.  The matzoball soup was hot and large in a good amount of liquid. I'm used to having chicken noodle matzoball soup, so this was a change. For the price, avoid ordering it plus something else.  The turkey club sandwich was tasty. I ordered it with toasted wheat bread. The sandwich came out so large that I was almost not able to fit my big mouth around it. This is a sandwich for which I would return to this restaurant to eat again.  Some of the charm of this restaurant are the people who work there, mainly the waitresses. They'll tell you straight up what is really going on and make sure you order food that you will enjoy. I have not tried the dessert here yet. Visit for the sandwiches and the authentic type deli.

Sre1219ePynkTkeBBPv39A.text: I could eat here every day.  It is that damn good.  The meat omelette meal was massive and delicious to the last bite.  See you soon!

Mlt8FZzgAxoqArmJ9Cg7Ig.text: Looking for actual Vegas locals? This is the place. Oldschool. Fresh. Bagels. If you are looking for fancy-schmancy or corporate-cookie cutter, you are in the wrong place. But if you like off the beaten path, mom & pop, every-day Jewish Deli slash diner food, you're in for a treat! The waitress might have been a little Ed Debevic's without the irony but so what. Expect it. After breakfast, we took a dozen bagels to go! BTW, CASH ONLY! By the way... If you are looking for schmalz it is available for purchase by the pound.

CHVGwiDMbzRPpobtDxWiKw.text: The owner, Old lady is a real grouch  does NOT understand the meaning of Customer is always right.     A customer asked for something in a certain way,  She refused and said NOPE and rather to throw people out of her store.  The request was a very simple  to have the sable in a bagel,  She said NO  we do not place sable in a bagel  it is always served on the side  period.  It was a take out order to go to the airport!    The cooks was willing to do what customer wanted but the owner said NO  we do not do that, she does not even care about if a customer is happy or not!    a True GROUCHY old Lady!    If you want a very pleasant service and SMILING faces,  go to the Bagel Cafe off Buffalo ave.  MUCH MUCH better service and people are smiling!  They CLAIM to be True New York Style place,  I am from NEW York and grew up in various bagel environment  and that place is crapoloa!

MprX3wLsouXu8Bja8Hydkw.text: Reading the reviews for Harrie's Bagelmania really makes me wonder if I ate at the same place as everyone else! I went there based on reviews from Yelp but had the opposite experience.   I thought the bagels were about as good as grocery store bagels i.e. doughy and bland. I was hoping for real deli food like good pickles and potato salad but the potato salad was worse than the bagel. My travel companions were equally disappointed. I ordered lox cream cheese on a sesame bagel and if I had not been so hungry, may have given it away.   Also, the woman behind the counter left our bagels sitting on the counter while she helped several other people who were ordering. By the time they shouted our order, my brother was done with his bagel and mine was cold.   I also don't favor places that use styrofoam and to go packaging even when you're eating there. I would not go here again despite my desire to support mom and pops over chain restaurants.

TpZBN08EmQGgfp2UPzeMGw.text: This place is truly a hidden treasure. It's a small, family-owned authentic Jewish deli with an incredibly friendly staff and it is SOOOOO GOOD!!!! Harrie's Bagelmania is so much more than just a bagel shop. Absolutely everything is hand made from scratch and you can taste the love. Their sausage, egg, and cheese bagelwich blows all other breakfast sandwiches out of the water. The matzo ball soup tastes like your Jewish friend's grandma made it especially for you on a chilly day. The chicken salad is more flavorful than any I've ever tried; it was delicious (and I don't even like chicken salad, I only got to try this one because my friend ordered it). And the biali...OH the biali! For those of you unfamiliar with a biali (like I was), it is a type of bread -- similar to a bagel but not as dense-- with tiny minced onions and other delicious flavorings in the center. I've eaten their biali with the chicken salad, with the matzo ball soup, with cream cheese, and by itself...all amazing. I'd go to this place every single day if it weren't for the fact that doing so would turn me in to Shamu. I highly recommend it.  Note: They are cash only.

R5qQSRcVRUxPz3_v1OHWKQ.text: In another life, I was probably born Jewish. I went through a phase growing up when I was obsessed with bagels, lox, etc. Hell, I even studied the violin for 13+ years. Harrie's helped reunite me with my long lost (and imagined) Jewish identity while i did my stint out in LV.  Harrie's, as others have said, is a tradition in LV. For me, it was a Saturday morning late breakfast with either their hash or 2 eggs sunny side up all served with a warm toasted bagel of your choice and some cream cheese on the side. The coffee wasn't the best, but who cared? I was sitting here for a chance glimpse of the Elvis impersonator driving up in his silver Chrysler Sebring. It's more about the ambience here. This is old Las Vegas, folks. Good hearty NY style deli food with cheery people who love the city and treat the customers right.  Yes, they make their own bagels. When you go towards the back, you'll see the bags of flour and the mixing machines through the kitchen doorway. And they make a killer bialy too. The prices are good too. There's a breakfast special on the weekdays - can't recall how much, but it won't run you more than $5 for 2 eggs any style, some meat, a bagel and a coffee. Why sit in a generic Denny's or Blueberry Hill restaurant when you can just relax and feel at home here at Harrie's?  5 stars for ambience and service, 3.5 - 4 stars for food. I like the bialy the best. Reconnect with your love for bagels...and give Harrie's a try. If you see Elvis, take a picture for me. Thank you, thank you very much.

b2pdqZFwb8j8P9lUIJ0naQ.text: Second stop in search for the best Pastrami. IMHO.  Had the pastrami on Rye. Although all was fine with the sandwich, I was a little disappointed with the amount of meat. I wanted a little more for the almost 11.00 dollar meal. You do get a little apple sauce and potato pancake, but I could have done away with that for a meatier sandwich. Oh well, the search continues.

AxIycxsWuwA1q0-x6Pln2A.text: Smoked salmon spread was chock-ful of smoked salmon. Bagel fresh, tasty, and full of sesame seeds. Super friendly service -- gave us complimentary samples of whitefish and baked salmon salads. And honestly the best black and white cookie of my life.  It's going on my Vegas rotation.

nfmIsKrAP4x3yoXaAubhVQ.text: I've been coming to Harrie's for over 20 years and we haven't been in a few years since it had seemed to go down hill.  We were in the area and went for breakfast a few weeks ago and it was great, just like the old days!  Def try breakfast here and the bagels are the best in town!  Go for the bagels and lox, not the service!

-hTk6WF2cdJ_hGMFQdeqlQ.text: This is a great place to just grab a quick bite ! Great service, been here couple times and never a let down. Location is the only sketchy part but it is still worth it !!! Love their chicken soup , matzo ball soup , bagel and their breakfast sandwiches. The black and white cookie is great also!

wLPjYCMoZvkoQI7dXRNgPA.text: The food is very tasty and quite plentiful. This is now going to be a regular stop when ever I come to Vegas.

lt7XibITkwW54tVUyyPI-Q.text: Great bagels, best I've ever had!  This is not your chain store bagel shop, and it doesn't disappoint. If you're in Vegas and you don't want to spend a fortune on breakfast at the Bellagio, take a drive off strip and grab a bagel. Buy a loaf of authentic Jewish rye to take home too, its awesome!

3HVQsZGV3vrxF7Py9qx8uA.text: I'm in Vegas every few months and this is a spot I frequent.  They're super friendly and the food is great.  It's seems to be more of a local joint, and it has that mom and pop shop feel. I get the hopplepopple every time without question. It comes with a bagel and I've never left hungry. I heart this place.

7gIxfKTXfTx1EgEFHMo7Og.text: I'm from the east coast and am a bagel SNOB! This place is wayyy out of my way but is definitely hands down the best bagel in Vegas! I got the garlic bagel w/ scallion cream cheese... Mmmm :) I will definitely be back!

m960IC2OfL1XbMBSH5I6rw.text: Another bit of NY in the desert. Easily best bagels and lox in Vegas. Go for the "Burton 1-2-3-1" very good. Orange juice is fresh squeezed and coffee is good.

9bnsl3Y-EF5WYUyXpIhZog.text: Great stop for breakfast! I had an Everything bagel with lox and cream cheese. It was delicious and had huge chunks of fresh salmon in the spread. Yummy! My husband had the $7.99 special of eggs, ham, potatoes and a Jalapeno bagel. He loved his too! We will be back!

vbbRR1i6oTKPz4Gi1td0sg.text: Love the jalapeno bagel here! And the lady serving us was so nice. My boyfriend got the scrambled eggs and hash. It was a looooot of food. I would come back for another bagel!

EEdODIIpiCHjiXCSWtw0vQ.text: The service was impeccable. The food came out so quickly and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  I've been to 5 star restaurants where the service wasn't as good.  Definitely coming back for breakfast.  The food and bagels are top notch too!

HSeRsXnGqmtcAJKkaT4ywQ.text: This place is awesome, it's not a tourist spot for sure. Mainly locals come here. I come here with a big group of people every morning for a week during SEMA, this place is great fro breakfast. We always call ahead to reserve a table and they always make rood for us and the service is quick and friendly. Can't go wrong with the breakfast special.

uWhHM6AlVOehwmp8e1pKNg.text: This is one of the best hidden gems in Vegas. REAL waterbagels! The only little Jewish deli in town. I love coming here. The waitstaff is great. My only wish was that it was open later in the day.

a9GHT9Wd0sN_c0d3SFxcJw.text: A friend who lives here in Vegas took me to this hidden gem.  My pastrami rueben was fantastic.  I'll definitely be back.

ysIuxWMS6ifavXygqDXEew.text: Extremely slow service.tuesday morning after ten.not even crowded.by the time I got my oatmeal, it was cold with old mushy bananas.my bagel was easily a day old and so stale and chewy I couldn't eat it, it hurt my jaw to chew.this place is awful, I'll never be back

88hiX4abBy8U9PrV6OV87A.text: If you want to feel llike you're sitting in a diner in somewhere in the Village eating bagels - this is the place! It's nothing fancy and you probably won't find any tourists in here (or gamblers for that matter). But the bagels are the best ones I had outside of New York City. And their Lox Cream Cheese spread is awesome! I would come back here just for that...!

e-xhXTV_iJ0sXxlrxN5iLQ.text: We were looking for a cheaper breakfast option on our vacation...  Bagelmania was the perfect spot.  Its a local place located in a strip mall a few blocks off the strip.  It was pretty busy with lots of local regulars.  The portions were generous and the food was great.  Try the homemade hash and a fresh baked bialy.  You won't regret it!

5w6GiSExTjVnMo96RsnZXA.text: Having been to Bagelmania in the years past,  I was completely underwhelmed.  The rye bread, pastrami & store - bought swiss  cheese was average at best. Relatively small quantities of both products. We arrived at 12:30 Noon to an absolutely empty restaurant. During the 1 hour of our lunch there was only one other sit down lunch customer. After our $34.+  2 sandwich 2 glasses of tea lunch we realized we;  "had been taken to the cleaners"  It is sad to witness the end of a Truely wonderful Las Vegas institution.  Thanx for all the old memories...

FyIemImFpf_7szpPk-CxKw.text: Matzo brie was off the hook.  The portions are huge.  It is very reasonable.  A great place for breakfast.

r6DDkn7SCyrnZ0ME0jEkAw.text: Don't let the location fool you! Went with a good friend of mine who has been coming here for years. The Reuben omelette was calling my name and sure enough, best omelette I've had! Huge portions for the price. I will be back! Yum.

OOjNrT9kyN3O8qbfTArxfA.text: We were visiting from out of town and were wanting some good bagels and we are so glad we stopped. Everyone was super friendly and the food was super yummy. Will be returning again the next time we are in Vegas.

edNNxcLVyEZ95UCLUcbEqg.text: Mmm! Loved my everything bagel with jalapeno creme cheese  Delicious and fresh   I loved the home-y vibe of this place  They pack on the cheese so be prepared for a delicious mess

y2Ko41V-ckoObJb9oZV8zA.text: Love this place! I always get the breakfast special with an everything bagel. The food is always hot and fresh and comes out fast. Service is always great! We try to come 2-3 times a month.

sNOhJr_cwdhoj-5TnamA9w.text: Extremely patient and kind staff. Generous with their food and lots of options for bagels, eggs, and other breakfast options. Very affordable and close to the strip

QDeLLkFe7Kqf4p-yaVlT3A.text: I used to work in the area where Bagelmania is located and would stop by for lunch to grab a quick bite. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the restaurant is, considering it is in a rough section of town. The bagels are top notch. My personal favorite was the salt bagel with chicken salad. Consistently tasty and well made. If you are in the area and need a quality lunch spot, look no further and try bagelmania.

wv8XB3MtMN0dOFhm8FxxUg.text: really NYCish place in Las Vegas. I'll definetely come back! Unfortunately they close at 2pm (sign says at least), though opening at 6.30a.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pastrami everything

WdtdxCVvYRXfdniyrVHoQg.text: I recently moved back to the Las Vegas area after several years and am glad Bagelmania is still going strong and making Bialys. I called ahead to reserve a 1/2 dozen and spoke to a cheerful, friendly employee who took my order. When I arrived I was greeted cheerfully and looked over some of the other goodies. I picked up some chopped chicken liver, 2 stuffed Knish and a nut filled Hamantaschen cookie. The bialy has a center of cooked onions and poppyseeds and was delicious. Crunchy outside and moist inside. The liver and cookie were also very tasty. I look forward to trying the knish. Super friendly staff and delicious food!

Yjy5CqRelZD0AzZtN7nRww.text: The best bagels outside of NYC. Under new management and the food and Service are outstanding!!!!  Plenty of free parking, and very easy to find. A great Las Vegas hangout for both locals and visitors !!!

3ywMht30lohRVQrSeUO9Og.text: We love bagels and bagelmania has a very good variety of bagels and other items on their menu. I can't speak to their other items but the bagels are great! I'm a breakfast bagel kind a guy and their breakfast bagels are awesome. Definitely recommend this place in Vegas! The last thing to say is the service, and its very friendly. They take the time to help answer any questions. Awesome place!

Ie3rC_FLXyE38gqek5f86Q.text: I normally only save 5 star ratings for the absolute best places and they are rarer than a unicorn. This place rocks!!!!!! I come here every time I am in Las Vegas and they have the best bagels and food. The neighborhood is somewhat scary but never had any issues. Service is fine. The reason to come here is for the food.  You will never run out of food choices.

IMNwKrfHA8fwXRZ_HwJ3pg.text: We went for a late breakfast, and as we walked in we were greeted by a wonderful smell of freshly baked bagels and very good smelling food. I ordered the onion Bialy roll with butter and let me tell you I can't stop talking about how I'm going to go back there the next time I'm in Vegas. Amazing food.

9HlbzH9-4DnHG2AXPv_oJw.text: stopped here for breakfast after finding out my 5 star hotel didn't have a decent breakfast available. Great bacon egg and cheese on a bagel. Friendly super fast staff. Highly recommend

KgFjwOvjwaH4YY64DiJveg.text: Just because I didnt ask how much a mini M&M cookie and another small cookie was the guy that seemed to be in charge thought that would be an opportunity to ripoff an old white lady.He attempted to charge me $2 each! When I told him I did not want to purchase them he lowered the price to what I think it was supposed to be in the first place.Disgraceful!

R72jtaOuzvw95nxAKBGcVA.text: Coming from the northeast, I know a great bagel when I find one.  Bagelmania doesn't serve great bagels.  That said, their bagels are quite good and, outside of the northeast, among the better bagels I've found elsewhere.  During our few visits here throughout our stay in Las Vegas, we got sesame, apple cinnamon, and egg bagels here, with the apple cinnamon being the worst of those by far.    The women who wait on customers were, without exception, friendly and attentive and efficient.  The man who did that for some customers was an obnoxious loudmouth who just would not shut up.  At one point, the two of us and one other customer were the only patrons in the restaurant, and the male employee (owner possibly?) was so relentlessly loud with that other customer that we could not hear our own conversation . . . and we were seated 2/3 of the way across the restaurant from him.  Amazingly annoying!

wtetJEQ-7WtX4eVCgDD-Kg.text: The vibe is really welcoming .. ......the staff is knowledgeable.   There's so much variety.  The bagels are huge and the schmears are loaded with chunks of veggies or fruit, depending on your flavor.   The area is kind of dicey, but the restaurant itself is so welcoming.

3JnSoN0odg5cWRuDJTGkfA.text: When my boyfriend suggested bagels (and Einstein's) I immediately thought of this bagel place I've seen numerous times driving down Twain. It's one of the only businesses left in this shopping center but it was packed on the Saturday morning we visited. You can seat yourself if you're dining in or order at the counter for takeout. My boyfriend got the bagelwich with a side of potatoes and I got the Burton's 1-2-3-1. We got our food quickly. The portions were huge, especially the side of potatoes. I was a bit confused by dish. The menu said it came with either a plain or onion bialy, but the waitress asked what kind of bagel I wanted so I got an everything bagel. She also asked if I wanted to sub the Swiss for cream cheese (yes sure). The real sadness was that I only got two slices of lox when the "3" in the name is supposed to be 3 slices of lox. I wouldn't care but when I know my dish is almost 3x that of my boyfriends because of the lox alone it was a little disappointing. Also, the "thin" onion slice was not that thin. Overall the meal was enjoyable though. Next time I'll probably opt for some of their cheaper options. It feels like a friendly neighborhood deli and most of the patrons looked like regulars. Definitely giving this another try next time I'm in the mood for a bagel.

ISjpDjjP15hqcBxlW8qZTg.text: At 10:30 AM on Dec. 10, 2018, my wife and I had the worst breakfast we have had in a long time. The eggs were under-cooked, the bacon was burnt and the french toast was just so so. I asked for no powder sugar, it came with sugar. The sugar-free syrup was questionable since it came on a dish.  Since the new owners took over, Bagelmainia went straight downhill. We will not be back.

nqC-yNulohbLOqECwPPICQ.text: I'm sad writing a one star. Rairly happens. But I just need to be honest. Place was dirty. The matzo ball had no flavor. The bagel that came with it almost broke my tooth. The potato pancake was very greasy. The applesauce tasted canned. Pastries were very good. Service was good. Bill came out to $36 counting tip for my girlfriend and I. Cute place but for that price, I'll be going somewhere else next time. Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vEcJdjzTS3_lbbCsMduW-g.text: I had the 1 bagel & the salted lox plus cream cheese, tomato, cucumbers & 4 olives. Cost $19.00 for this. A little expensive but it was delicious & worth it. I'm from California & this plate is more there.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JoPQAXA11D6LYR3bvJGT0g.text: I'm originally from NY so I don't usually have much expectations for Las Vegas bagels, but these were delicious!!! Also some of the biggest, most full bagels I've seen on the west coast . Their homemade shmear is also a must have!!

s-3miqvU4Me3cJJpHg5Usw.text: Great Jewish deli, but be forewarned: they are not open for dinner. Great bagels, bialies, kugel and chopped liver. Extra laudits for the bagels and sweet kugel, which was awesome! They even sell fresh schmaltz! Everything I've eaten here is good except for the cabbage borscht. It tasted like something schlocked together from various canned food. Avoid!

P95W5bGn23-BLdtRj0F89Q.text: So I got really excited about there being a "Jewish" deli over by where I live, as I've been missing that style of food since moving to Vegas from Los Angeles.  It really was an old-timers place, the kind where people have been going there for years and the waitresses know your names.  I was probably the only person in the place under 40.  I liked the feel, and the food was decent, I had the corned beef hash.  I've had better, but on the whole the meal was perfectly acceptable.  However what got me was the bill, $19 with tip for corned beef hash with a potato pancake and a cup of iced tea.  For that price I could've gone to the Stage or Carnegie Deli on the strip and gotten what would probably have been better food.  Will I come back here, probably, since I get that food craving every now and then.  And be forewarned, bring cash, they don't accept credit cards.

5vy89a-fNI7Lh2jAUcPSTQ.text: As a Jewish girl who lives in a predominantly Mormon state, I was thrilled to find Bagelmania.  The best corned beef hash I've ever had and the bagels, amazing.  Great black and white cookies and we picked up some pastrami for the road.  The cole slaw a little too creamy for my taste, but everything else terrific

fq5o1bkiuvFmTo5QLvWUGw.text: Bagelmania has been around for a long time. They have great food and their bagels are amazing. The only down side is that they don't take credit cards. ...It's a bummer it's cash only.

Dp0rGtS-x_E-upfNsjqJ3w.text: Just come here to get a great bagel. This isn't your crappy bagel like einstein bagels. These are homemade. Cash Only.

TuC9o8uXAyLir-fQFvO_Cg.text: I took a stroll down memory lane this past weekend (Yes, it was homecoming at UNLV) and ate here last Monday.  Old Mort is on that cloud in the sky now, but the memories are still there at Bagelmania. Yes, 'tis full of old East Coast Jews in the morning, and the breakfasts are served by the same 'ol fuddy-duddy women who served me as a young kid from San Francisco years ago.  I had the specials, which consisted of bagel, sausage, and three eggs.  I took two of my pals who happened to be celebrating homecoming as well.  We spent $24 on coffee and the specials.  All was served efficiently.  Same rude service, but mind you this place was packed early in the morning.  So head to that 'ol strip mall on Twain and Swenson in the 'hood, and grab yourself a special (if you read the RJ, don't clip the coupon.  It's an advertisement) and a toasted onion bagel.

Xc1puizbB2wbcEt4E_lYDQ.text: This place is awesome.  went there super hung over from an epic night and the food is perfect.  Awesome breakfast potatoes, bagel sandwiches with egg, cheese, and whatever meat you want.  They have it all. Its close to the strip.  Not a ritzy place at all - the ATM gives you a receipt and you have to get your cash at the front desk!??  Price is legit though - you can have a full breakfast for $10 easily

ubNNDLaa88og5L03swkAAQ.text: I swore I would never review Harrie's Bagelmania (correctly spelled) but since the secret is out, I will give them the props they deserve.  I wanted to keep my secret place empty for myself.  This is by far the best breakfast I have in Las Vegas....even better than the Maple Tree which is very yummy.  It is a dumpy little place in a half-deserted strip mall in a so-so part of town but the food is good....really good.  All the egg dishes are yummy/  They understand bacon well done better than anyone.  I'm not a big fan of their pancakes but most people like them.  I love the bagels...yummy, heavy, proper bagels.    I have been coming here for 15 years.  Every time I go to Vegas I go to Bagelmania.  I brought a party of 10 one Sunday morning and they sat us right away in the back.  Everybody at the table loved it.  That is unusual to get 10 folks to sign off on a place. The service is always appropriate.  They won't wow you with being overly friendly, but it is prompt and attentive.  I highly recommend Harries for breakfast....but in 15 years, I have never had lunch there.  Try it once.  You will probably like it.

-THJrv3ejw-mq4LFCL61xg.text: Bagels, Bagels, Bagels. Terrible name, great bagels! This is a little family owned Jewish Deli. The food is pretty good but the bagels is where it's at. Closest thing to NY bagels that I have found in Vegas. Real, boiled, NY bagels with great cream cheese's and many other hard to find kosher items. If you like the mom and pops places then this is a great place. Make sure you bring cash because they don't take plastic here.

rfV6Mo8kH-ZYt7PCpODwjg.text: i have only tried the bagels and bagel sandwiches here and i go back weekly.  enough said :)

u0fQnrarAGnrQPLfWmMxlA.text: Omg.. bomb.com..will stop by here everytime I come to Vegas, here on out.

wNmsViJvfv8-j_LeevMq-Q.text: The bagels were average, didn't think there were anything that blew me away. Although the "natives" in the neighborhood would probably blew me away if I made eye contact with them. Even the waitress gave us attitude when we tried to pay with credit card. I suspect the place is part of a "front" for the mob for money laundering, hence the cash only policy.

6u3LfBmz_qwYB080zw2LuA.text: I went here after reading all the Yelp reviews.  I don't understand all the rave reviews.  Nothing special AT ALL.  I ordered a pastrami omelet.  (Don't let that fool you... they do not have a giant selection of omelets, although you could specify ingredients to create a custom dish.)   When the plate arrived, I looked down to see a rather large portioned omelet that was stiff, fairly hard, smooth sided, compacted and in the shape of a triangle.  I immediately compared it to the looks of a tan colored cranberry scone.  There was no evidence of a yellow or egg whites.  It was all overcooked and brown.  If it wasn't for the triangular shape i'd say it looked like it was baked too long in a shoe.  yes, the texture while eating it was exactly as it looked.  Rubbery and flakey. Brown.  The omelet came with a bagel and diced potatoes.  The bagel:  Nothing special AT ALL.  It's not like you are going to Einstein's bagels or anywhere of that caliber.  It was not extra tasty or extra large.  I was surprised at that for a bagel shop!!  I usually love hash browns or other types of breakfast potatoes.  Not this time.  These diced potatoes were mushy and sticky in a weird kind of way.  Like warmed mashed potatoes that were cubed, and that stick to the roof of my mouth like peanut butter, but not as bad as peanut butter.  it was just weird. I'm sure that this was the first time in 30 years that I did not finish my breakfast potatoes.  It was only after I got my bill that I found out that the cheese that my waitress suggested ("what kind of cheese do you want on your omelet?) that I found it that the cheese was $1.50.  I wouldn't have ordered the cheese at all if I had known it was extra.  Here is what breakfast cost me (for myself):  Pastrami omelet:  $10.99, cheese: $1.50, Milk, 20 oz:  $2.75.  With tax my total bill was $16.48 not counting a tip.  If the pastrami omelet was not the most expensive item on the menu, it was right up there.  So yes, you could very easily get your entree $3 cheaper.  I would not recommend this place, because although it was unusual to have an pastrami omelet, it, and the rest of the meal, did not taste special at all.  I wish I had explored elsewhere.

X7Sn9GZisPFGWkoHxNkGGA.text: What an awesome place...Top quality food..you'd think you were eating in a deli in Chicago..The reuben omelet is to die for..the saurkraut is like no other i've ever tasted and the eggs taste so fresh...plus the portions are HUGE...DEFINITELY my first choice to eat every day... Prices are well priced...People there are friendly...

0mCrnZwd8LZ-kpOOe0cbPQ.text: I am afraid to tell anyone else about this place as then it will be too busy and the prices will be raised - but I also want them to stay in business as i just bought a house in vegas. East Coast - the real deal. try it once - you'll be back. Do not go for the ambiance - in fact - get take out. It's just the best.

ikNMIsZ0SpD_089dx9ki0g.text: I live on the westside and drive across town for this. It's never empty for a reason. While the lady at the counter seemed kurt, she was very helpful. At first I thought she was aloof, but when I asked for a bagel sliced, she told me that they charge for that and was I sure because even she thought that seemed unnecessary. I appreciated that. They are always kurt but helpful. And the salt bagel and bialy are the best. They even have the best cream cheese. If you can't tell the difference, you may be satisfied with other places. But if you are a True bagel snob, this is the place! Cash only though!

2yrzJzGRc42YL0NQjOD3xw.text: I've been looking for a good Jewish Deli since I moved to Las Vegas. I picked up a friend from the Airport and he told me that we had to try this deli, so off to Bagelmania we went.   When we walked in (around 11am) it was pretty busy. There were only a few open tables, and we were promptly seated. We ordered the whitefish salad appetizer and it was GREAT. I haven't had smoked whitefish salad like this since I lived in Chicago. Served with a bagel or your choice, and dill pickles, it was all very tasty! Paired with a Dr. Brown's Black Cherry soda, how could you go wrong?!?!?!?!   Next came the Lox, Eggs, and Onions, served with Home Fries. Just like grandma used to make (jk). The servings are a good size and the atmosphere is very casual. The bagels are the best bagels I've found in Las Vegas. My friend ordered some Rugala to go to snack on in his hotel room later on. We had to break into it just to have a taste and they were very good.   They have all kinds of meats, cheeses, salads, and desserts available for quick carry out. If you're looking for a great Authentic Jewish Deli in Las Vegas, this is the place to go. They are open 7 days a week, but only until 3pm.

3a6H6XgVLv0kyEsNvhKl7w.text: Pretty good bagels, and good overall breakfast.  I liked the fact that it was a deli and had a large menu.  However, the bagels were a little denser and not quite what I'm used to.  We have an Einstein's here that I really like, and I guess that's what I've come to expect.  Harrie's may be more traditional, but I didn't like them quite as much.

sUoB3Rnr7UzPgvTG8VPUAA.text: Fun place - nice to get away from the strip for a while. Good bagels, though the coffee was so weak it could have passed for tea.

OdUEJNQE4GwNwEO83eG_ng.text: Bagelmania is a great hidden gem in Vegas.  Bagels are great, the cabbage soup, and the LEOS are top notch.  If you find yourself in the middle of town for lunch, it's a great place.

0rbQofBtUqm_TQNen7A5DQ.text: I'm not happy to even give this place one star.  The bagels are only eatable if they are toasted.  The owner hasn't updated the restaurant ever, much less since I've been going (25 years).  It's unkempt, borderline dirty.  You have to go through the kitchen for the bathroom.  Today is the last day I will go into bagelmania for any reason; $3.50 for A black & white cookie.  Crazy and very sad.

KIkVy2eyw-zR19EjkMePRw.text: A True delicatessen. Don't let the surroundings discourage your patronage. Bagels were insanely delicious and fresh. Wait staff is efficient. Woman behind counter gives it a New York flair. Will stop here on every trip I make back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The name says it all! The bagels are amazing.

IsrgAAIGA-FA_EYiCmIxQg.text: Visited Las Vegas and no visit is complete without a trip to Bagelmania.  We have been going to Harries Bagelmania for many years and always came  back to Californian with several dozen bialys.  This is a type of an onion roll that's dipped in the center and onions are placed there along with a few on top.  Growing up In NYC this was a staple.  These are so hard to find unless you go back east.  I have searched the internet and found on place anywhere near me that has this on their menu.  Anyway, this is the one thing I like to bring back for me, friends and family.  So sorry Harry is no longer with us and I am sure he is missed.  The new owner which we met yesterday is a lot like Harry.  Warm, friendly and running a great place.  The waiters are helpful, accommodating and friendly.  Now for the food, Best salami and eggs you could find.  For us lite eaters a bagel, egg and bacon/sausage/ham is perfect as is the price.  Cream cheese and Lox.  Yummy.  Chicken soup, corned beef, pastrami.  I mean, what else could you want from a neighborhood deli and bakery.  STOP, EAT, ENJOY

2b63-wxlSnrKRvNdgOrlcQ.text: Food here is great . Some of the best tasting Bagels on this side of the US. Bialys are also awesome. We come here to eat every time we go to Las Vegas

x6wmjI3Rd2qUpLShzI7knQ.text: I am not a die hard bagel fan but no one is talking about Harrie's super sandwiches.  They have the best egg salad I have ever bought.  The white bread must be fresh baked as it is sooo soft and they are thick sliced.  The triangle sliced sandwich is huge!  But wait , , , , there are pickles!!!  The absolute best home made dill pickles in the world!  No jar of pickles will ever be good enough for me after having theirs!

gTp5q3O0cmNoOxh9YH5OIQ.text: Excellent service and great bagels! Close to strip and safe location. Lots of parking directly out front. Lots of seating. Clean and welcoming.

l4RVBk-bB_FFSrplsLX6wA.text: Best Jewish deli food around! I will drive from anywhere to get my hands on this matzo ball soup and bagel chips. I had their roast beef sandwich too and I can't wait to go back and try the rest!

dUZg4PnNNNB1cRl15GIvCA.text: Harrie's continues to be a staple in my Las Vegas breakfast life! I've watched family come and go(sadly) but the memories stay the same! Great Food, Good Friendly Service! And QUALITY! Keep up the good work!!

8y3ooYFuWPA-DN7qscdlQg.text: Really authentic bagels and great tasting cream cheese. I had a garlic bagel and it was savory. The potato knish was a bit different with potato chunks instead of completely mashed.  Nonetheless it still was delicious. I chatted with the friendly owner - he's a very nice guy.  Highly recommended near the Convention Center.

7nJ4zFRp3bCGB_uqBNOE0Q.text: In town last month for a trade show and our group was looking for good bagels. A yelp search brought us here. The bagels were amazing, as well as some of the bagel sandwich and other breakfast entrees our group ordered. We even went back the next day, though disappointed in the service, the waitress called off and the other one was new. After waiting 15 minutes we were informed it would be awhile still, we had to order breakfast to go, the staff tried their best to accommodate but we were only able to get bagels to go. Regardless will still go back when we return in August.

jf-hZTzOyTRvOh31KZDymQ.text: Great choice for a quick breakfast before heading to the Hover Dam. Pleasantly surprised to be greeted by Harrie herself. What a nice lady! Their bagels and tuna salad get an A+ (and I have had my fair share!) Reminded me of the hometown Jewish deli I grew up with. Done right!!

grgoJTRtSdFHBBrmrgYxzQ.text: Stopped in for breakfast before the long, boring drive back to LA.  Easily the best lox I've had since I can't even remember when. Onion bagel and chive cream cheese were excellent.   If I lived in town, Is definitely come here for meats and baked goods.

5Ypr5zdfCVogrRSj6Qp9lg.text: BEST bagel I have ever had! EVER! They catered a huge order for my work and I am in heaven! I had the salt bagel, but everything else look and smelled AMAZING! Great place!

XFDP-J1SPIQZpjVeDX4M6w.text: Nice and simple. Lots of bagels and spreads to choose from and even some breakfast dishes. Located in an abandoned mall but not far from the strip.

-xwefgVeyq2X8CbAkXIW4Q.text: Came in ordered the burtons 1231 which is lox I had it with a garlic bagel cream cheese red onions! Was one the best I ever had! Friendly staff! Order came right up! Nice and clean! Will come again! Loved it!

4_6EXLDfVs2JZ2l9-BxyKQ.text: Can we just start off by saying how  FRIENDLY the staff is? I ordered the eggs Benedict. Hollandaise made to order?? It was perfect. Eggs were poached perfectly. The ham was a little thick for my taste, but not worth taking "points" off for everything else. The Hubbster got the Rueben omelet. Delightful in all ways. The Bagel. OMG. Friggin perfect. When toasted it was crunchy on the outside and warm and chewy on the inside. Bagelmania is now my go to for bagels and lox. FANTASTICKA!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lox Platter for 2!

9_hBp7p84dwKvP5TMgd9GQ.text: Great bagels and billies. Lox, corned beef, pastrami, whitefish salad, matzo ball soup all are delicious. Nancy runs a solid deli you can count on. Always great. Used to be top political spots in town.

7ODc2Dh_fmiiciPWLwU2hQ.text: So glad we made an Uber trip away from the Strip where we were staying. Do yourself a favor and come here for breakfast. Had the hash and an Egg bagel with american cheese, fried egg, sausage and bacon. So delicious! Was a little apprehensive with any bagel place that claims to have great bagels. This place lived up. After living in Long Island and Jersey, I can recommend the bagels here. Get in an Uber and come here for breakfast. Huge portions too!

Igyoh4W9GIPpucP2OLh1sA.text: Great variety of options. Homemade with lots of flavor. Friendly service. Family vibe.

5tnsXEUptv3BQapzWVUCfA.text: This place has won awards, had to try it. You do have to drive through a bad part of town but it is worth it. The staff are friendly, nice and helpful. The food is outstanding!!  The breakfast plates, bagels and kugel all taste great, the price is reasonable, and the breakfast plates are large portions.  I visit this whenever I am in Vegas, even if I have a free breakfast somewhere else, I will go here.  Definitely a wide selection of people and a lot of locals and regulars, but I felt right at home. Plus it is close to the convention center and not too far from the strip.

T0gLF1MKXkqSgCxn87PgpQ.text: Bagels are a great size and have a good portion of cream cheese. This place is always fast. My only con is the flavor. I got blueberry both times thinking maybe they just made a bad batch the first time but they didn't. It just tastes like bread with cream cheese, no flavor at all. My bf got garlic and he said it was good so just FYI to avoid the blueberry if you want something flavorful.  Overall great place aside from that.

LF1OsqXI9TMTP29DkILFqA.text: I always come here when I want to celebrate my inner Jew that my ancestry test claims I have.   We used to come here as a family when I was younger. My grandfather was the original Yelp and knew of all of the amazing spots no matter how far or sketchy they were. The decor has an 80s/90 and should probably be updated, but I'd like to think that's what makes this place so special.   Their bagels and everything else as already mentioned are a bit pricy. I compare them to the bagels from your bagel chain and it really doesn't bother me. I haven't had breakfast here in long time. I'm usually just here for an everything bagel with schemer right before class at UNLV. Happy to have this spot with so many great memories so close to home!

MVJVtN1d0o9_NN_aiqmmvQ.text: Spending a lot of time in the NY area and now living in the west coast, I miss delis like this. This place has great delicious NY style Jewish food. You can't really go wrong with any food item. The place can get busy at times but the wait isn't bad at all. They also have a bakery section so you can get your sweet tooth fix.

IEdeex71iotnPyLm8IO-qg.text: I've been wanting bagels when we took a recent trip to vegas.  We were at the UNLV campus so I checked on yelp to find the closest bagel shop with the best reviews... Harrie's Bagelmania popped up. It was very easy to find.  The shop shares the parking lot with other stores surrounding the area.  We went right when they opened.  The staff were so nice and friendly. It was our first time there and they were super helpful.   I ordered the breakfast bagel sandwich which had a breakfast sausage, eggs, and cheese, and a choice of bagel. I also got a lox bagel.  Both were very delicious... I did opt for the everything bagel but the onions were a bit burnt on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage breakfast bagel

MJpaiFeoYPhAQzfbRt0NfA.text: Ok I have eaten here twice in the past 30 days. The first time I took my family because I was excited to have them enjoy the food. What a let down, are food didn't come out all together and people who sat after us and ordered after us got their food. It took 3 times for us to get our food.  Ok my family can go elsewhere I was still ok with this place. I was so excited to eat here today, we had a work lunch so we placed an order (we had 8 orders). I told my family because I was jazzed up for a bagelwich. I got my order today and it was wrong. What a let down today!!!!  Serious my order was easy. I guess I will no longer eat at this place.

I4S6toqzxpYub27qN7kqOA.text: This place looks really decent. I got two lox bagels today. And I have no idea how or why? But the bagel was the saltiest thing I've ever tasted. It tasted like someone has poured salt in the bagel on purpose. It was absolutely horrible. Not to mention  we spent $15 for a lox bagel. $30 wasted. Don't get it. Worst part is that we are headed back to Los Angeles and we're unable to return this sad excuse of a bagel. So annoyed

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1SygAC0JHZmXVHrIBLVPZw.text: I placed an order with Bagelmania from N.J. to surprise my fiance with hangover breakfast for his bachelor party. Gary was more than helpful and wonderful to work with. All of the guys loved the amazing breakfast!!  I definitely plan to visit the location when I make it out to Vegas!

Kk5mOeRilYy-sCbrHehxRw.text: 4 dollars for a bagel with veggie cream cheese. I was expecting one amazing bagel for that price. Instead I got a burnt , tasteless drenched in disgusting cream cheese monstrosity. The cream cheese was bland AF. This place should not be in business. I had high hopes for this place too considering all the positive reviews.

qZT_XundGigFTHy2aVi1gQ.text: This is a must visit if you're in the area. Our group of 6 was seated quickly and the service was outstanding. We all got different items and everyone was very happy with their selections. They even brought around homemade brownies and cookies for us to try. Try the bagelwich!

N9U5dMsFYxVWouX7osWnLw.text: Awesome atmosphere. Everyone is so friendly. Food is even better. The price was reasonable, I got a bagel sandwich and some kind of delicious flaky chocolate pastry, it ran me $4 because the waitress just gave me the pastry. Great customer service will keep me coming back! I would recommend to anyone and everyone

EuX4hgjbFZI_tqa_HB1mgg.text: I wish so badly that I had known about this gem sooner. The menu has everything from breakfast foods to lunch to oddities you simply can't find at many other places. Everything is delicious, tastes homemade, and affordable (unlike most restaurants in Vegas). It's quaint and quiet. A perfect place to study or read. I'd give it more than 5 stars if I could.

DnS8DmFlN72DJl6z57BpzQ.text: Terrible management  The new managers spends his time bragging and catering to his friends. While 20 year plus clients wait and watch as more his friends came and we sat waiting for a bowl of soup  38 minitues later we left while others sat with menus in their hands Weiss deli is the place to go!

Yj9miIjO2XgnxuaK3tVbKw.text: Stumbled up on this place and so glad we did. Man do they give you more lox than you pay for and it was worth every penny. Really amazing

RozU7qa3WI4E6746M1ModQ.text: Literally like, look no further. The nicest people you'll ever see! Best of all, the Bagels. Are. Amazing. The owner came and this morning and she's the sweetest lady. Come and have yourself a bagel!

_plX12cKiJqLz0dvPWiRXw.text: Loved this place! Everyone was so friendly, especially Renae. Great bagels, great schmear and everything else looks so delicious, too! We'll be back for sure!

6w4nppiBf6j3P1tqcml3WA.text: BagelMania was the best meal of our trip! We are from California and wanted something that felt like home and not too heavy for breakfast! The service was Amazing!!!! The waiter, Erik, was one of the best we've ever had! The manager was just as great! It felt so good to be so welcomed when so far away from home! We will be visiting again soon! Thank you from your California Bay Area friends that love the Dodgers and Lakers!

fgfd2O-g_BV3dekBxQdYNw.text: Ya know.. there's something just kind of special about stopping over at Harrys  for a bagel.  An excellent delli with an eclectic crowd something similar to a feel that you might find in New York City. The neighborhood is sketchy but the parking is super close The bagels to me are absolute perfection, some may  disagree with but for me, the best in town. Harrys has kept me coming back for 20 years .  There is no reason to come here other than enjoying the atmosphere and the food. Oh that's right what else is there. :) People watching!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame bagel with Lox spread .

OS8WoAfFsp2g0fEyXk50QA.text: Service was great but the bagel was cold and was just your average bagel. If you want your bagel warm I would ask for it to be toasted extra.

Sn6IfFtOSXV23kuWbuV2bA.text: Old school Jewish Deli with great food.  No frills dining, but they're the real deal! The bagels are awesome, as well as the scallion cream cheese and lox.  The service was excellent.

Hhvc97szFshZ6DZJiwMKLg.text: This is one off the best breakfast places I have ever ate at. Every time I come to Vegas I make it a goal to visit. The service is great and they are very friendly. I recommend this to everyone who wants to eat at a good local lunch/breakfast place.

DpKIEVVj5P8UWl7Yt9KAEw.text: For over 30 years we've enjoyed mornings of great food,  great friends, great times!!   Highly recommended to anyone who wants the best "double-bagels" anywhere.   Enjoy!

9hUBSoJ4RNMzlJLksTsdqA.text: Moved to Vegas from New York almost seventeen years ago. One of my main concerns was where to get my bagel fix. From the first time that I set foot into Bagel Mania I knew that I had found a home.Consistently good. Breakfast or lunch. All the basics done right. Excellent place for lunch especially because the home made soups are excellent. If you like bagels the old fashioned and authentic way, DIS BE DA PLACE !!!!  Best bagels in town. No contest.

VsCi8IK3vY-vCKZe8Tv70w.text: So very few choices for a real bagel in Las Vegas. I'm not even referring to a real "NY" bagel which is subject to interpretation. A bagel is a specific bakery item that needs to be baked according to that recipe. This place and maybe one other does just that. It also happens to be a great NY style bagel so I like it that much more!! Everything always fresh and made to order.

mv07RAMJEEDI67fgiinvqw.text: I love this place!!  The food is fresh, made to order and REAL.  The bagel/Biale and lox spread is to die for!! No need for the full lox, the spread is LOADED with lox.  Stupid Yelp has me visiting a couple times, but I have been at least 6 times.   It's cash only, but they have an ATM on premises.   I do conferences and tradeshows- so I come thru Vegas reguarly and this IS my breakfast stop. It's close, fast, fresh and delicious!!   Look for the locals- you will see them over and over. The staff is also the same day in, day out.  And I am ROLLING, laughing at the pregnant woman's dissertation on how bad this place is...she could have stopped with "I'm pregnant".

v94_zfGU4R59ewmJBQQ0eg.text: Terrible service. They offered me fruit as a side then came back and said they had no fruit, they offered me cottage cheese, then came back and said no cottage cheese. I got so frustrated by their lack of knowledge I said I was just gonna go somewhere else so then they said well we already charged your card. They gave me a hand-written receipt for my charges instead on a printed one and said my credit would get to me "when the owner gets around to processing her charges" no definitive time or date given. So now I have no meal and I have no idea when I'm getting my refund if at all. This place is run terribly AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!

wnmEJJ3Szz-2mIeW2MQz_w.text: Seriously... Jewish Delis are a significant point of weakness for me. Fresh bagels. Ridiculous portions of food that should never been mixed together or consumed in one sitting. Especially for breakfast!   Harrie's is no exception. Hot coffee coming right up- you will eat to content and from a smorgasbord of delectable homemade options. If you eat here all you will say on your way home from Vegas is, Oy Vey! Who needs a buffet?!

nBA-AgltJm08kn9wjx4F9Q.text: I ate here yesterday.  I had a bowl of matzo ball soup and a pastrami sandwich.  The sandwich was good.  I have been here many times .  I loved the soup.  However this time the soup tasted like a bowl of water.  I was shocked.  I do not know who is making there matzo ball soup, I hope this place improves there soup.

mpGcSxhhO8_BP5mu_4N38w.text: I have been wanting to try this place for sometime now and finally did it. I have been looking for real Deli's in Las Vegas and other than the Bagel Cafe and Carnage's at the Mirage hadn't found any. I had the best Pastrami Sandwich I have ever had today. The negatives, they charge $2 for a slice of cheese and the sandwich is pretty small. I usually try the Matzo Ball Soup too but this time I ordered Mish Mash (Matzo Ball Noodles and Kreplach  )  to go and will have it for dinner. On Tuesdays they sell Bagels $6.50 a dozen which I was told they make their own and Corned Beef and Pastrami at $12.50 a pound. I need to come by on a Tuesday and stock up. It's on the east side of town so they close at 3PM. Take the time and GO

OHUr7Q8834rbU0cZ0lrlxw.text: It's in a real crappy part of town. Prostitutes and Drug dealers galore, only thing that breaks the scenery is stepping over the homeless! So, the location may not be something that Harrie's can control, but their service IS. My husband, visited the store earlier this morning to get our family breakfast. I am newly pregnant and was craving a lox and cream cheese bagel with the traditional tomato and lettuce. He arrives home with a lox cream cheese SPREAD (not even a slice of lox... they say they are like a real NY Bagel Place, having been to NY several times, and having loved ones their, I KNOW that the spread is the kiss of failure in a bagel) then they put lettuce and a hunkin huge slice of red onion.. WHO DOES THAT? Like that is how anyone would order an effin bagel.. SO, when he got home, of course I was upset that my sandwich was incorrectly made. Asked my husband for the receipt, he said that they didn't give him a receipt.. no surprise. I took the sandwich in.   I was met at the counter by an extremely overweight lady ( who couldn't even stand, she had to lean on the counter the whole time or sit) who asked if she could held, I said, "My husband was just here and ordered this and other stuff, and my sandwich is wrong. It had this huge slice of onion on it and I wanted it with tomato." I opened the sandwich from it's foil wrapper to show her. She push the bagel back to me and said "Well, that's how he ordered it." I refuted telling her that he knows how I like my bagel and he would have NEVER asked for the fresh onion. She and I went back and forth for a second, she grabbed my bagel sandwich, while it was opened with her dirty hand and slammed it down on the cooks line and said "scrape the onion off and put tomato on it." I said "No, I want a new sandwich all together (because she put her dirty hands all over the bare food) or I wanted a refund" She grabbed the sandwich threw it in the trash an then she yelled  "Get the hell out of my store!" I told her that I wouldn't leave without a refund or a new sandwich.  You have to understand that in Vegas people in this neighborhood must always be on the run, so she thought by next saying to me "Leave or I will call Metro would scare me and  I would run out the door leaving her as a victor (with no refund and my sandwich)... but I responded with "Call Metro, as far as I see it you are stealing my sandwich and money! I Don't have merchandise that I asked for and you aren't giving me the sandwich out of the trash... so either refund me or give me a new sandwich, If you refuse I will stop payment on the card that I used." "I will call and have you arrested!" She said. I responded with "Oh I will pay you what I owe you, but I will not be charged for something that you won't fix or refund me on. I don't allow ANYONE to BULLY ME! That ended on the playground.. and as a adult, it is NOT OK to be bullied out of your rights! "She grabbed her calculator and started to try to figure out what she would have to refund and it seemed as if it was either (or both) that it hurt her to figure it out because it was too hard, or she realized that she would be losing cash in hand and all she had to do was fix my order (I mean how many bagels gets thrown away in a day anyway just fix the sandwich)   She finally understood that I wasn't leaving and that she either had to make my food over or refund me the money.  She kept telling me to go sit down and she would deal with me later and wanted to help the regular (Jewish) customers. I stepped back, then she says to her customer loud enough for the regulars sitting there and eating  "Yeah, she is mashuga!" Having been deeply offended that she would pull that sort of card on me, not a cool thing to do as a business to start slinging religious terms to cut down on another person in a way to show that I am an outsider, not being part of their religion. I knew in a second what she was pulling and I wasn't going to allow this. I dated a Jewish man from Brooklyn. I understood what she was pulling! I tell her, "What you don't think I know Jewish? I know what you just called me!"  Finally, after a bunch more words that represent nothing more than poor customer service and bullying by her, she succumbed to my request and fixed my sandwich. The food, when I finally ate it wasn't that good. The onion on the bagel was so burnt that I couldn't taste the flavor of the bagel itself and the lox spread was kinda gross.... the produce was fresh at least... I just think that it wouldn't matter if the food was absolutely wonderful, I wouldn't patron a place that is all smiles to you until there is an issue and rather than helping you they spit in your face and tell you to get out or they will call the police. I wasn't loud, beligerant or rude. I got there towards the end though. I asked nicely and got the door anyway.  You decide for yourself, but, I say. "Spend your $$ at a place that respect you!"

UyR29i9jgjptyWXUZ410cQ.text: The food here is excellent. I could tell the bagels were made fresh and the cream cheese was delicious. I got the hoppel poppel, which was an extremely large amount of food. I recommend splitting that between two people. The portions are large in general so come hungry. Our server was extremely nice and took good care of us. My only complaint is that half of our food came out 20 minutes before the other half of us got our food. Overall this is an excellent place for bagels and breakfast.

X3dDZ2wxk_N_G6sVbHt28g.text: Harrie's Bagelmania-This place has HISTORY-It's a part of the fabric of Las Vegas an old school NY-style Jewish Deli.  In a small shopping center at Swenson & Twain its just between the STRIP and the Boulevard Mall. Also in the same center is the HAIFA Restaurant another Jewish eatery.  It's known for its Friendly service and REAL food. FRESH made bagels and More. It's a little cramped in there with NO boothes and most patrons are regular who are WELL-FED! lol  They know your name and what you are gonna order before you get seated. Along the back wall is a mural of an old school neighborhood with people looking out their 3rd story window of their brownstone hollering the ice cream man-etc(you get the picture)  Well they have polaroid cut-out of REAL customer taped over the faces on the mural to personalize it-VERY COOL!!  As far as the food goes-I guess you have to be Jewish or from NY to appreciate it. Eggs & Onions,Lox with Onions, and Matza just not my cup of tea Being an Iowa Farm boy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fbcrDLvj54gvr_zZGix5Sw.text: Harrie's Bagelmania is an excellent deli. I had a nice bagel, a nice bialy, and a good pastrami omelet. I mentioned on another discussion board that I thought Weiss' Deli in Henderson had the best bagel Ilve had outside New York and I had a couple of people say they thought Harrie's was better. I've eaten at both places only once, but I think I like Weiss' bagels better. Harrie's is still a great place. Everything tastes freshly made. Service was excellent at Harrie's too.  The everything bagel I got was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside, just like it should be. I also appreciate that they make their own pastrami. It's cash only.
