HNVesBx4d1cbdNPWFJ4UMg.text: We unknowingly showed up with about 30 minutes before closing and were the only customers there. The staff didn't seem annoyed (as can happen when you come in just before closing) and the service was very good. The food was delicious and very authentic...unlike the chain bagel restaurants. We'll be back next time we're in town.

SoK7DpxixStFUg40v_uDTA.text: Real pumpernickel bagels!  Heaven.  This place is open only for breakfast and lunch, but I go for breakfast when I have a chance because it reminds me of the deli of my childhood, Shapiros of Indianapolis, when I go there then. Although it is not as great as it was when Harrie was alive [he died a few years ago], Harrie's widow lovingly keeps his restaurant and his deli alive. Go first thing in the morning and you will see a cross-section of the real Las Vegas -- politicians, cab drivers, general folks -- enjoying a good meal. It is worth it just to go for the "show."  It has a real deli feel to it.  Something which is missing in other better known Las Vegas delis.

4RwJhyG91ZBKDytejpBfIg.text: Super cheap & super awesome breakfast! They really know how to do breakfast right here, with super huge portions and fresh hot breakfast. My friends and I ordered food from here to-go and brought it back to our hotel to eat. We couldn't believe how much food we got!   I ordered the 3 eggs with potatoes meal combo. It came with your choice of bagel or toast. I got the Jalapeno bagel with butter, and it was super delicious!! It`s even better because it was close by and has lots of parking :)   The waiters and waitresses are so nice and helpful.   A must visit if you`re looking for a cheap breakfast place and not feeling like buffets.

kCJPeiTY9ULkAPDDDsISVA.text: This place is like a real, authentic Jewish deli...according to my husband who is a Jewish boy from New York. Best bagels in Vegas. Dine in food is also excellent. We are Californians who come to Vegas 6 times a year and stop here for bagels every time.

OWpd0QPnth0len6_R-wZkg.text: Great service, fresh bagels, great prices. Come here and take a refreshing break from the strip. Next to the 7/11.

WxCoNM-TqXKqWQW8k9PKaw.text: Love this place been going there for years it was perfect fit lunch in between classed when I was at UNLV. Best bagels in town.

-8OmAD8DKZB8gXgYp_fcQA.text: This place is not near me but went when nearby. Fantastic bagels! Brought back to office and had rave reviews. Hard to get decent east coast bagels here and this place hit it. Also had a meat knish which was ok but a bit bland.   I'll be back...

2s4eYD4-cXKBBQIqEb8J5g.text: Really enjoy coming here for breakfast! The food is excellent. Delicious bagels, and excellent matzah ball soup. My husband enjoys the brisket sandwich.

sry8Cm8QtQw8qkH7bYRX3g.text: Sooooo disappointed...  Let me set up our story: I am a lover of NY knish...yep even the square ones you can find at a dog stand. And hubby is Jewish from SF. First generation American. Together we are a dangerous bagel seeking, knish seeking, lattke seeking pair of weirdos. I guess we expect the lattkes to be like his 90 year old grandmas and the knish to resemble something his Israeli family could whip up. Bagels? I guess we expect ones you can find in SF and NY.  This place has none of the above.  The service was bad from the get go and I ignored it because I was excited to find a place like this.  I immediately ordered a knish to start with and it came...huge...weird old dough and skin on chunky potatoes inside. It seemed microwaved. And I kept tasting it and trying to find hints of caramelized onion or leeks...nope...some onion powder at most.  Next I ordered a potato pancake (as they called it) and of course we expected a lattke. Nope. Seemed also microwaved and it looked like my old college day salmon patty I used to whip up and bake. Basically it was the texture of a ground veggie burger.   Ok. Now for the bagels. Hubby ordered egg whites and tomato on a garlic bagel. I ordered Nova and an everything bagel it came platter style with cream cheese, red onion and tomato. His bagel was hard and it had dried garlic flakes on it. My everything bagel (I requested non toasted) was also hard and seeds and flakes were burnt on the top.  We sat in silence and I ate my room temperature Nova and he ate half his sandwich. The server lady kept giving me the stink eye and I thought I was just imagining things but hubby said something when we went to the car lol.  So for the crappy coffee and stale food that we took mere bites of...we paid our $32 bill plus a tip at 9am and never looked back.  Honestly, I guess we just expected waaaaay more than day old tasting items.   *sadface*

Uh4fPGWByIGG-gxoDyB8kg.text: So glad to have found this place! Reminds me of a place you'd find in New York, small family owned and delicious! I had coffee and a ham egg and cheese bagel sandwhich. Definitely worth a try!

60JbUCfm_jidAqdx5ghFbQ.text: If you go here, don't expect anything special.  It's very much an average Las Vegas eatery, which means it's below average if you're from the real world.  I guess if you've only had Vegas bagels, this could be a 3-star, but I'm being very generous.  It's not authentic, and it does not have a great menu offering.  The food they do offer is very bland, and simply below average.   Make sure you have some time to spare.  The wait can be very long, and the staff is almost purposefully slow.

Toe2i15WSOjG71U6L8Ptqg.text: As you drive by you don't imagine a great little breakfast place is inside. The staff is fast and very polite.  The food is great and a breakfast sandwich on a bagel is just about $5.

8ln-vuVKCIxzwrJeJrLQIQ.text: Day one, I had an everything bagel with lox cream cheese. Delicious. Second day had the corned beef hash with a breakfast bagel. Day one was better than day two, but we are comparing greater and great.  Don't let the exterior appearance fool you. This place has been making everything from scratch for 21 years. This will be a regular visit every time we come to Vegas.

UgFxfn9WXncZ4C1qs95RmA.text: Good for breakfast and brunch. It is located in a rough part of the city. I recently moved closer to downtown so I drop by often.   Nova/lox sandwiches are my favorite. Be careful, Lox can get too salty (or was it the other way around??). You can get all your standard bagels. All of them freshly baked. Hash corned beef is very good. A side of them is big enough for 2.   it is a good deli in that part of the city.  Not a world-class place  but good for Vegas and the best you can get in that area.

1zEKML0DZgRI0DO75R1lXQ.text: Are you shitting me? This charming place is in the sketchiest part of Vega$$ and yet it's the cutest little place ever. Frequented by retired people who have a whole 'nother appreciation of the beauty of a relaxing breakfast, I found myself charmed by the environment, the service and the food.  It serves all day, and it's one of places that tourists would never find or make a destination, so I feel a bit of Las Vegan ownership already.  I'll go back again and if you want some company, hit me up, I'm sure I'll be game.

euwbBDB7CDsitbm2GA2o_Q.text: Awesome place.... Soooo underrated!!! Staff is amazing and friendly... Being from NYC it's really hard to find a good bagel out here! But this places shines through that.... By far the best bagels in Vegas. Always fresh, always delicious!!!! I promise you won't be disappointed with this place!!!!

5V9Y6JWrOdpsEbn1Uc3EMg.text: Place is very good! Many options for bagels,cream cheese, and omelette. One thing I loved about this place is: they had fresh any kind of cream cheese. Service was quick and food was hot. Price were also reasonable not to expensive.

SwtzlLhUz0V7cMamC8y7Fw.text: This place was fantastic, I would have given it 5 stars except for without any notice about a year ago (it has been a while since i last went as i dont frequent vegas much) they changed their cabbage soup recipe. It used to be the BEST cabbage soup i have ever had in my life. It was the reason I went here. It was thick delicious tomato goodness with the best cabbage ever. Now it is the most bland disgusting watered down garbage ever. I have not been here since and do not plan on going back. I actually asked the chef who makes the soup and he said they made him change the recipe for whatever reason and he agreed he liked it better before too. I asked one of the hostess too and they said it was because a customer complained it was too thick or something.

lxhkXrdt9qJubCjYTsXR2Q.text: Unbelievable customer service!! We were visiting from out of state for a hockey tournament and our final game was running long - we were going to miss our mandatory stop on the way home. One phone call asking if they might be cleaning up and let us stop in for our order was all it took. They were incredibly kind and accommodating- I can't tell you how refreshing that is!! We love this place and we HIGHLY recommend to everyone!

i68rfXVAOL0QUpaWMZHwqQ.text: Harries probably has the best bagels and cream cheese I have ever had. They are fresh bagels baked right in-house. I would say that this is definitely a hole in the wall, it is not in the best part of town in Vegas but it is quite worth the trip for a good breakfast.   I had the apple cinnamon bagel with the cinnamon cream cheese and it was a great pair. The cream cheese wasn't too sweet either (as I've tried their strawberry cream cheese = MY FAVE before). I know that when I go to Einstein bagels or something, the cream cheese is extremely sweet. This place has it in moderation so you get the best of both worlds of a hint of sweet and the cream cheese flavor.   The bagel quality makes this place get 4 stars-- not 5 because of the horrible service we had.   The lady that took our order and served us was NOT enthusiastic at all.  When she handed our meals, she did not even repeat what we got, she literally just placed it on our table and walked away.   I was astounded at how someone could STILL work in a restaurant with that kind of attitude. Vegas is known for their hospitality and maybe that lady was having a bad day?   Who knows.   Regardless the quality of Harrie's bagels are a must-try.

33j1WkomG-TVwH5S25iSbQ.text: I miss Jewish delis in LA. Nate and Al's, Brent's Deli, Canter's, etc.  This is THE closest thing.   I stopped in one morning when I was craving a heavy breakfast. I got the everything bagel with nova and cream cheese.   For the first time in my life, I had a choice between Lox and Nova. If you don't know the difference, google it.   The Nova and Lox are priced per lb, and its a bit pricey, but who cares. You get what you pay for.  I am glad this place is down the street from my office. I'll be back!

n_YcfACiNuHW5gdwVD2AYg.text: We're Jews from NY, and these are the best bagels we've had in Vegas. Felt like a bagel shop in NY. Good prices, and they have a dozen bagels for $5.50 every Tuesday. If you don't like these, keep going to your suburban imitation bagels spots. This place is for people who can appreciate an awesome bagel.

edGM0rqkUQK-TblFtTuuUw.text: Awesome breakfast. Pancakes were super fluffy and grits were real grits, not instantly. My husband got steak and eggs and the steak was decent for a breakfast place and eggs were cooked over medium as asked. We got this delivered by Uber Eats and everything was piping hot when it arrived. Good breakfast!

Eim-17eTZtBVpNAlVTF2Ig.text: Harrie continues to deliver. We brought some friends here who had salivated upon hearing of our past experiences, and they seemed to think it lived up to every last drop of the hype.  Menu highlights the smoked whitefish and sable platters lived up to their reputation.  Prices seem to be increasing with the minimum wage and/or the scarcity of smokeable fish, but still a good value.

uF4FFJja0Kzk9kThJqj5Kg.text: I've been coming here for years... You have to try the pastrami... Get it on and everything scooped bagel.... The food is great... The people are even better... Food is just awesome...

EgKzo2fAaHlAJBjMadHzYA.text: This former New Yorker gives the puffy luscious bagels a two thumbs up and monstrous knish an A++ for it's perfectly seasoned russet potatoes and tan flaky dough. Brings me straight outta Brooklyn- my childhood :-)

6LCaGcElNAsOW1D8k_prfg.text: I stopped by for a lox bagel with cream cheese to-go this morning before work. It was delicious ( a little greasy) and came with olives. They seem to have a lot of breakfast regulars from the east coast.

hp9QJjL3UEzAgONpHPkX8A.text: Unbelievable bagels here and even the hard-to-find bialy. Want to experience a bit of heaven? Order a toasted bialy with butter and a poppy bagel with the works. I got mine to go planning on heading back to the casino but took one bite in the car and sat there and ate everything in stunned silence. I wanted to head back in and give Harrie a big hug. Next time I'm in Vegas I'm heading straight to Harrie's. Also, the Nova was melt-in-your-mouth great and even rivaled Canter's Deli in LA for best lox anywhere.

NV63hjpPfuJe1EDS7lTZBw.text: I have been coming here for over 25 years.  The last few times I have been here, it has been getting worse. Today was the last straw. I won't even step foot in this place again.

3rMRpWPSQzzOpoDFoU6RPw.text: I work for Postmates.  I came across this gem when picking up an order.  I enjoyed the decor of the building itself.  It seems to be a place for locals.  I decided to try it e my partner.  And it did not disappoint.  I had a bagel egg sandwich with ham and Munster.  Our waiter Dennis looked at me when I asked for American cheese kiddingly.  My meal was awesome.  It was seasoned perfectly.  Thanks Bsgelmania we will be back!

cSwBv2ilLZW_bXb8VCvfLA.text: My bagel was amazing. That's mostly the input for here. Was picking up someone at the airport and needed quick, portable food for a long drive. I ordered an everything bagel with chive cream cheese, which is pretty much my go to in all situations. The bagel was toasted perfectly and as the perfect combination of crunchy outside and soft inside. The cream cheese was whipped so it was not too dense and was flavorful and perfect. Would definitely give this place a shot!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most perfect everything bagel with chive cream cheese you ever did see.

IBQo6hcIesZqr0Xy1QBMlA.text: It was very good.  Finding New York style bagels and deli food at a reasonable price in Vegas. Will return when in we come back to Vegas.

yUdcwlUlzgUNObpzTI5qYg.text: The best bagel shop in United States. My wife and I come here every time good in Vegas. If you're in Vegas doing this on this bagel shop. All the locals come here

m1KKU4ntoCdJHYfNIZMYLA.text: As bagels go, they don't get much better outside of New York and Montreal. Their lox spread cannot be beat. The ratio of lox to cream cheese is very generous and delicious. A friend from New York visited me in Vegas (he lives on 23rd St in Manhattan) and I took him to Bagelmania. He insisted on going back for breakfast again the next day and picked up a dozen bagels to take back to NYC with him.

xnB96rjALuxTkGrwEs-PjA.text: Service: Mom & Pop shop with attentive service! They do tend to get busy during morning hours, so you may have to wait a bit. I usually try to call in my order.   Atmosphere: Classic NYC deli feel. Its a big smaller than their competitors across town, but it has everything you would need. LOVE the drawings on the wall.   Food:   Bagel with Cream Cheese: 7/10 I LOVE their egg bagel. It is soft and chewy with a nice flavor profile. Their plain cream cheese tend to be on the bland side, so I would go with their flavored cream cheese. They have quite a few for you to choose from.    Bagelwich: 8/10 AMAZING! If you've never tried Muenster cheese in a bagel. DO IT. This place has really good Muenster cheese (much better than Bagel Cafe). The chef is also very accommodating. They can do egg white or regular egg. They will do no oil or light oil if you are trying to be health conscious.   Nova Lox Bagel: 8/10 You get veggies options with this. Cucumber/chives or tomatoe/lettuce. They gave a generous serving of the lox. I enjoyed this sandwich =)  Price: $$. My sandwhich run around $5-$7. Lox was around $15. Feels pretty standard. A little cheaper than Bagel Cafe.   Overall: Recommend! I didn't really care for their regular cream cheese. Other stuff was good! Will be back!

HwocOjbyteH4Wa3PKAyE2A.text: The food here is amazing! Great service from Cheri too! Don't skip on the homemade desserts.

q1ajXKxujlKD7UBw8G3K0A.text: With my friends had a great experience in Bagelmania, the customer service was great. You can make your own breakfast with different bagels. I recommend it strongly.

ddJNFWcMKNoqeQPC3cLVtA.text: It's been a year since my last update, and since then I see either new management or ownership has stepped in, place is the same, menu is the same, but definitely seems to be run more smoothly with increased customer service.   I ordered the Kreplach soup, as usual, and it was good, no freezer burn and plenty of noodles and vegetables.  Pik attached.  Glad to see it apparently plans to be around, even longer...

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kreplach Soup, as good as ever; 12/28/18
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kreplach Soup (with 1 extra Kreplach!)

omM0r-wHb7h3Fwy5nOGsmw.text: Perfectly toasted bagel with yummy cream cheese and luscious lox! My matzoh ball soup was good too. And to top it off service is great! Got a free black and white cookie and piece of rugalach

Zu5eWvoqs0vncNSrmhcgyw.text: Stopped in here on our way out of town. Bagels are phenomenal! Wish we would have taken some for the road.

YAKwqUN8-3biMxxe5Lxvkg.text: Great local breakfast spot. The bagels are amazing & the food was delicious. This is my new spot for breakfast in my neighborhood.

48v0RnSdJpdzVBI-Jggb7Q.text: Service was friendly. A little slow considering that it wasn't that busy with only two other tables but the server was nice. The bagels were a big let down. I ordered the whole wheat bagel with jalapeno smear, and my husband ordered the everything bagel with cheese and bacon. The smear was nothing special. I expected something creamy with a kick of jalepeno but other than the visible chucks of jalepeno and hint of the taste it was like any other spread. The bagels themselves though were the big let down because they didn't taste fresh but we're a bit chewy. I've had better store bought bagels that I toasted myself with plain cream cheese spread.

nNB-rKhlL3fmZLWmiYyOTA.text: Local bagel place in a strip mall. Good coffee and a decent bagel. Clean and friendly.  Full of locals so I would guess it's consistently good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lCfTDrIwWPw1GCgi6jYDsg.text: Stopped here because it was on the way home after picking up a friend from the airport. Very old school neighborhood, and by that I mean I wouldn't dream of coming here after dark, which should tell you a lot since I am a seedy tenement dweller myself, but still..  Besides, it closes at 3 p.m. so you should make it out safely, even on the winter solstice.  The restaurant is in a pretty empty looking strip mall, which didn't seem nearly as vintage as the rest of the surroundings, and inside it's small but perfectly clean and cheerful.   It was afternoon so uncrowded when we arrived. Service was friendly, and I decided to try a couple of old deli stand-bys : bagel with a schmear and cabbage soup.  The bagel was big and toasty with a generous helping of cream cheese, and the bowl of soup was huge. The broth had that sweet/spicy/tangy combo flavors it should, along with big chunks of tender beef, which were unexpected and really served to make it a full meal.  The broth was a little thicker than I would have liked, but it was a ribsticker for sure.  My friend happily chowed on her triple decker monstrosity involving pastrami and corned beef, neither of which I consider fit for human consumption, so we'll have to take her word of approval on that. Yuck. Did intrigue me enough to consider going back another time for brisket or chicken salad, my other faves. Not inexpensive like you might hope in a little dive, but good quality.    One of these days I'm going to find a place that serves complimentary pickles and rye bread like the good old days and that fifth star will be on the table.

0kREHuTAlnEd6PzS9BLQBA.text: Been coming here for years. Used to be the best bagel in Las Vegas. I know there is new ownership but they definitely did something to the bagel recipe. Not even close to the authentic NY bagel that have been served for years. No flavor whatsoever. Won't be back. Not worth the 30 minute drive.

8w8RGBAW-67LVeStT1Btzw.text: Service was good. Bagels and coffee were both very tasty. I was disappointed in the hash browns that were served wet, white and bland. I have never had breakfast potatoes that were wet before. I will return to see if it was just a bad day on the kitchen grill. Many menu choices that I want to try for breakfast and lunch. I will try them again.

EcwCa_yYSJ3X9VGQrK0VZw.text: We love bagel cafe, but moved to the other side of town and needed a legit bagel spot. We don't like the crap at chains like Einstein's-- their bagels aren't chewy and their cream cheese is not great (just for reference). After searching Yelp! we decided to check out Harrie's.   We ordered a breakfast sandwich with egg, cheese, and bacon on an everything bagel in addition to a blueberry bagel with strawberry cream cheese and took our order to-go. Service was quick and friendly (we were helped by the owner herself!) and our order didn't break the bank. The bagels were delicious! We've since returned and ate-in, enjoying another breakfast sandwich on a jalapeno bagel and an everything bagel with plain cream cheese. We're going back for a third time this morning.  I would argue that for a bagel place, there are limited bagel options, but the options are good. If it ain't broke, don't fix it! Harrie's has been here for 25 years for a reason.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious breakfast sandwich!

PD4hzLKdq9lo2UcBzYWmyw.text: Great food, coffee and bakery at a great price. Friendly staff and quick service. Definitely make a stop here if you have the chance!

oD56lB1bU_xUPLJNnt-vFw.text: Fantastic Jewish deli. Bagels are wonderful and the lox was piled high. All the traditional flavors including pumpernickel and egg. Bialys too. Ended up taking a dozen for the road after eating here be cause we knew we'd want more for the next morning.

Mq8VfrExZuKdQPA7F74huA.text: Best bagels and breakfast in town. 3 minutes East of the strip. New York style bagels. Very friendly and plenty of parking. Had eggs and bagels. Must try this place if you haven't been yet.

2aBoaad7f62HcNe2o0T39g.text: Love this place!  Came here to get some breakfast to go.  We took out some bagels and a knish.  Bagels were good and fresh and the knish was good and authentic.  Good prices on those.  Also took out a couple of OJ's and milk to wash it all down.  The drinks were a bit pricey and ended up being more than a third of the whole breakfast.  Next time, we'll head to the grocery store for drinks.    The place was clean and the staff very helpful.  Would have liked to eat in but not this trip.  Definitely recommend.

Fvb9_brt-t1t6XlYmG1Cww.text: Once a month, I treat myself with 2 bagelmania garlic bagels and a half pound of cornbeef. I can't think of a better meal.   Keep note: if you eat here once, you will get uncontrollable craving for their food. Nothing will satisfy but the real thing.  I've been told the staff is grumpy, but they've always been very nice to me.

5MjYKsfT4QiJ4MVJbV8WOw.text: In the most bizarre strip mall along crack alley is where you will find Harrie. I get to drive through here everyday on my way to work, so I've become familiar with Harrie over the years. I boycotted for about 7 years but recently started coming back because I was sick of Einstein's.   I love an everything bagel, and what I love even more is when "everything" is on both sides of my bagel. I found that here. Problem is, their bagels are really hard. Really, really hard. My usual spread is onion & chive. I find their spreads here are really thin, if you were to hold the bagel to on the side, it would slide off. I tried the Lox spread and it was so incredibly salty, I ended up throwing it away. What I do love is the cookie case. I've tried them all, and they are all pretty damn good.   Also I think their prices are a little steep, $3.78 for a bagel & cream cheese (did I really just complain about prices for a Jewish deli)? Yes, I did.

00IHhDakT82r0y15n0D-hg.text: So yummy to find a bagel spot here in Vegas. Nothing fancy, just good bagels and great service by a local waitress. The basics are where it's at!

XjsfxQN0bUJzNthLtzDOPw.text: These guys are Tribe members and know their stuff. Support your local Jewish Deli dude (and Italian, German etc) and keep the quality alive. These fake deli chains stink! Their bagels are fresh made err'day and they really care about quality. I wad impressed by their Salt bagel especially. Yum!

T5LZrFTOjPmi-yUqNhiIjw.text: We have been eating at Harrie's for years.  It is our Sunday morning go to place especially when company is in town.  The hoppel poppel is delicious, loaded with salami and the portions are definitely big enough to share.  The bagels are tasty, sometimes just a little doughy. The sandwiches are big and very tasty, especially the Rueben which is my favorite.  In addition to being a restaurant they have a deli and pastry counter for take out by the pound.  Everything is always fresh but perhaps a little pricey.  It is for sure a locals place as  you can tell from the clientele enjoying their food and the company of each other.  The staff, for the most part is friendly and accommodating.  My only disappointment is that they are only open until 3:00 p.m.

hmf1IIg0mDT5D60ebEyFig.text: Real deal bagels. Also great selection of authentic New York style deli offerings. Always friendly, a bit pricey, but worth it for food you can not find it very many places this side of the Mississippi.  Overall the best place for bagels and lox or rate pastrami sandwich.

hWMtiGiWwBagMrrhN4fvWA.text: ok so this is a pretty sketchy part of town,but it doesn't bother me or worry me. In the course of doing business in los angeles I was always in industrial or areas where business's had their warehouses in run down areas. I was pleasantly surprised with this eatery. Its a bit of a drive for me but runs about 1/2 the cost of bagel cafe. I had their 7.99 breakfast special. Onions and eggs sausage patty's (2) potatoes and a bagel. This is good old fashioned large portions and good food. quite a spread from the ripoff that is the strip,and basically a stones throw from there. Its near the convention center so for all you visitors its an awesome fillup on your way to long full day of work. For value they get two thumbs up! the service was also right on point. I will say it would be nice if they improved their coffee, a bit weak for my starbucks palate. otherwise a solid good value.

31Pw9oa_rVFXxIThCCaYwg.text: We went here for breakfast one day to try and get away from the super pricey meals on the strip. Plus the hubby really wanted a bagel!  The waiter was so nice and friendly, and the place was full when we got there, so that is always a good sign.   I had the brisket sandwich, it was ok, definitely lacked salt. It came ice cold, and I wondered if that was the Las Vegas way of eating it. The waiter assured me that it was not. My husband ordered the corned beef hash with scrambled eggs. The eggs were not cooked through and had some raw, runny spots. The waiter was apologetic and returned it to the "chef". He completely copped an attitude, and actually started complaining about us to the waiter and someone else behind the counter! Dude, we are sitting right here, and can hear you!  Anyway the hash was different than we are used to, but it was still good. Everything lacked salt, but I guess I'd rather have to add, than deal with too much. I would give it another try.

ekhPD9hJSNmOuGbep2v2Yg.text: We love bagels - get them at Einstein's every week. This place does bagels right. Creamy whipped cream cheese with lots of great fresh bagel options. Really good eggs and bacon too.

pB9tgnIgRRBEqlC36r92ng.text: Dirty silverware and dishes.  Bagel was good, not enough cream cheese.  Table was sticky and not clean.

ieuA6OcxnaDNhkRZKdl6jw.text: My husband and I were just talking about how Las Vegas is becoming a close second to NYC for us.  Las Vegas has the shows, the food, etc.  The one important thing that Las Vegas was missing was the NYC bagel and pizza.  Well now they got the bagel.  Thank you Harrie and Nancy!   I tried the jalapeno and cheese, sesame, everything, and poppyseed.  They were all very very good.  Just enough bite on the outside and chewiness on the inside.  What i was truly impressed with was that the lox spread had actual chunks of salmon in it.  Very, very yum.  I also had the vegetable and strawberry spread, and they were also very good.  Nancy mentioned that she adds no preservatives into her products.  I think that's all the more reason to give this place a try.  You won't regret it.

Cz9VFNBGRbiJ79dbW_4S2w.text: Somebody erase my browser history because I have died and gone to heaven.  This is a True New York Style deli. Generous portions of lox and cream cheese on fresh homemade bagels melt in your mouth. Grumpy old men with newspapers and the hint of old school Las Vegas make this place a must try.   Close enough to the Strip for tourists but far enough away for a local crowd too. Prices are more than fair.

Jgm4cL6kLZo_ONQGpGh_iA.text: I love bagels and this place has the best!! The pumpernickel bagel is my favorite. You must try the apple cinnamon cream cheese!!

eVKP7kai9paU6yqfYHHrZA.text: If you are in Las Vegas and headed to the Convention Center make an effort to stop at Harrie's Bagelmania.  This little deli is a nice change from the glitz and glamour of The Strip.  Many locals stop by here for breakfast and lunch.  I was in the area recently.  I took the RTC city bus route 108 from McCarran Airport.  For $2, the bus will wisk you to Harrie's in 10 minutes.  It's in a little strip mall on the corner of Swenson and Twain.  Despite being a deli, they offer sitdown service.  One entree that I enjoyed was their Three Fer plate: knish, potato pancake and a blintz.  It comes with sour cream and apple sauce on the side.  On my recent trip, I had the kasha knish.  They also offer a knish with potatos or meat.       I would definitely return for breakfast and lunch.  The staff is friendly and food was fresh.  As their name implies, they have a host of bagel combinations.  They do close at 3pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three Fer plate: knish, blintz, potato pancake.

pv42MKkataQ4KRonC9a9NA.text: If you cannot tell nova from cosco lox, do not bother. If you like real, NY bagels, good deli, big portions and friendly service, try this family run place. Run as it was 20 years ago, no frills, just good food. What a concept!

VC65Uy0zZ2S7AgFQkQyFZA.text: Great little bagel shop with a diner feel.  The decor is old fashioned, some may even say run down, but I thought it was quaint and no-fuss.  I love that it is a local establishment that serves good quality food.  It wasn't crowded on a Friday morning, so my girlfriends and I immediately got a table and our orders taken.  I ordered an everything bagel with lox cream cheese (cream cheese with smoked salmon in it).  YUM.  We were visiting Vegas so we also ordered a dozen bagels to-go with a pound of cream cheese for about $12.  Not bad considering it was supposed to be breakfast for the four of us for 3 mornings.  I think that's about as cheap as you're gonna get for eating in Vegas on vacation!

7Z-pXwuaVanM1nuXHp3L0A.text: Seems pretty much like any bagel shop/deli that I've patronized in the northeast- family owned and operated and tons of regular customers of the senior-citizen class. I was about to drop $14 on the Nova platter when the waitress told me about a cheaper option that was exactly what I wanted. Bagels were huge and very tasty and I would come back for breakfast next time I'm nearby. Decor is outdated and so is this part of Vegas, but supporting a local business never goes out of style.

VB-dhLiC6Oan8Eoc7FKuAg.text: I have been stopping into Bagelmania periodically for the last couple years when I am craving an authentic bagel on the way to work. I always do to-go and have never dined in but they have a dining room and full service menu.  Bagel, dessert, meat and bread options are abundant and delicious. You can order large or small quantities of all of their offerings.   Service is always friendly and you can tell it's a close to the heart, family owned business. Reminiscent of NY style delicatessens my parents would take me to when visiting their birthplace of NY.

8o_ALA4t7J6gslfphmdoUQ.text: I wasn't feeling the breakfast options at the hotel/casino I was staying at so I sought out something local. Cue Yelp and Bagelmania. Lots of storefront parking and numerous tables inside.  When I walked in, I was immediately greeted by the staff who were eager to assist me, though I confessed I needed a little time to look over the menu, which they handed to me. I was craving a breakfast bagel sandwich but for some reason had trouble seeing it on the paper menu. The owner (I assume) laid out the options for me on the wall menu and I realized it was categorized under "Bagelwiches." Ordered a Bacon, Egg, and Cheese Bagelwich and a Bialy with cream cheese to go. Though it was still early on a weekend morning with few patrons inside, they were fulfilling large delivery orders, but I waited no longer than 10 minutes to receive mine with a couple packets of hot sauce in the bag by request.  The Bagelwich was good (though it was on a Sesame bagel rather than the Everything bagel I ordered--not a big deal because it was still delicious), and the Bialy was huge! and filling.   The owner personally thanked me for coming in--I suppose it was obvious I was just visiting--which was a thoughtful gesture. When I'm in town again I'd likely to come back and dine in for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Bagelwich on Sesame Bagel (actually ordered Everything Bagel, but it&#39;s okay because it was still delicious)
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg, &amp; Cheese Bagelwich - good
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bialy w/Cream Cheese - huge

N3ix03wCZNHmlQg5LtydXg.text: Ordered to go from this place as I was leaving Vegas to travel back home. The waiter there wasn't really helping me decide with what I wanted. Then after he did help me situate my order, I had to wait like 5-10 minutes for them to prepare a pastrami sandwich that literally was just pastrami and dry rye bread.   Whenever I've had any pastrami sandwich it has come with some sort of mustard. They handed me my order in a bag. In a to go box. I open the box to the dry sandwich, some fruit, and a pickel wrapped up.  As soon as I took my first bite. I knew I messed up ordering... They didn't place any mustard in the bag, utensils, or napkins. I was left with nothing but pastrami, rye bread, a pickel, and fruit.  The sandwich was made with no love, just ingredients packed together. Felt scammed for paying $12 for a less than par sandwich.

EF8Pu8z4Yer33e16_WXDuA.text: My husband drove to an Einstein bagels and we didn't know it was inside the University campus so I yelped for a new bagel joint that was only a few minutes away. It's away from the strip so I normally wouldn't come this way but they serve the best bagels and just like a New York bagel instead of the gargantuan ones at Einstein or Panera. They make all their own pastries and bagels every morning and it's a small deli as wee.   They're super nice and friendly and the coffee smells so good. They serve black and white cookies and hamantashen which I love but they only had prune and apricot filling and I love the poppyseed ones.   I'm definitely coming back when I'm in town next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xOHpGkI-4Wq1FYDu5rFmLw.text: Been some time since we have been here but since we were on this side of town twice in 2 weeks we stopped in for our bagel and smear fix. Bagels are still as great as ever with nice portions of chive cream cheese and lox cream cheese. They have a new menu under the new ownership and some prices have increased. Lox platter price is quite high which is why we switched to Weiss deli. Service was spot on both times we went. They are moving to a new location closer to the convention center around the end of the year. Still a great spot when we're in the neighborhood but Weiss is still our go to Friday deli spot.

Qq5MIS8hVoKmvpHOXCfeIQ.text: Not as good as it use to be but I will still eat here while in town at least once, just not everyday.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F8b1LxR53S-Lq3zsFUtgmg.text: Really great bagels and super friendly service. I LOVE off-the-beaten-path, hole-in-the-wall, locally owned and operated diners. I would rather go somewhere like this than some big chain restaurant. The baked goods were great and the owner was there chatting with us, and you could tell he put love in to what he did. They claim to be the best bagels in Vegas and they probably were!

MqykPnvHDOIbxn9e7MAbUg.text: First & foremost, make sure you are a patient person. It looks like a New York deli & it feels like one; it even comes close to an almost identical taste too. The biggest challenge I had (& I wouldn't really call it a major problem) is the service part seems a little unorganized. You don't know whether to seat yourself or go to the front of the line. There isn't much staff so it's quite a long time for some basic menu items. Please take major note, the staff that is here, WORKS EXTREMELY HARD! What may seem to be the owner (who works behind the counter) is the only person that paid attention to me. The server that is running the floor not once asked me anything. Not even a 'is everything ok?' until I was just about to depart & he asked if I wanted some water (with a smile). I had to go ask for a glass of ice which again was quickly brought to me by the Owner/Manager.   Ok so aside from that, the food is FABULOUS!!! Egg Bagel with cream cheese. I wish they put the cream cheese on the bagel so it would have been slightly melted when I got it but that's ok because it was a very nice & tasty texture. The everything bagel with fried egg & bacon; cooked to perfection. Egg was perfect, bacon crispy, bagel; delish! Oh & nothing would be perfect without a Dr. Brown's Diet Black Cherry Soda. Yummmmmmmmmy!!  They were very nice & gave me a little taste of the chicken salad (my favorite thing for a lunch item other then deli meats that I will have to try next time). Unfortunately the consistency was more like a paste then an actual classic chicken salad. That's just a side note & not directly part of my review.   As I mentioned above, I WILL BE BACK! I need for my the deli meats on a bagel sandwich. I have to say I'm pleasantly happy leaving feeling like just for a little bit I was visiting New York.  Thank you for the delicious meal! Price point was really good & everything you do is with a smile! Cheers Bagelmania! See you soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0btpHBcmw0ly_SXivEZ1lw.text: I love bagels and found this place. They have a good selection, huge portions and good prices. I got the Breakfast special that had 3 eggs, bagel, hashbrowns and bacon(could get ham or sausage) all for 9.99. It was very good and I couldn't finish everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast special and side of fruit. I ordered crispy bacon and they delivered!
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall mural.

37uNkMOWjSRX9mVR43J3ug.text: Native New York Jew grew up on bagels. This is not even close to NY style.  Next time I visit Im trying somewhere else.  In a very seedy area with tons of weird people hanging around.

dtpuOK9cZ72uu9X4JgpZSg.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day I've been told, so I wanted to expand my breakfast possibilities by trying Bagelmania.  Since I wasn't able to go in person I went through Uber Eats. I ordered an omelet which comes with a side and a Bagel. I ordered the same exact thing two days in a row.  The first day I ordered it , the food was very very good the omelette seemed adquate and there was actually enough cream cheese on my jalepeno bagel to make it worth eating. It was a very satisfying breakfast.  The second time I ordered the exact same thing, it was inconsistent from the first. Although The Omelette and bagel were again very good this time they put the cream cheese on the bagel (instead of on the side) and it was less cream cheese than i got the prior day. Also I found a piece of someone's rubber glove in my meal....parting gift?  I'd probably order again from here but I was hoping for more consistency.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A piece of a worker&#39;s rubber glove

yDU-HWahSVAmEBYxIRKhjQ.text: Arrived at 9am, with some doubt that this might be any good. We walk in, and was greeted. very nice staff. We dined in so, they gave us an extended menu then what's on their wall. My husband and I Sharad a breakfast 3 eggs and hasbrowns. Came out Very fast and Very Yummy.  For Bagels we ordered a cinnamon raisin and blueberry bagel. They are very flavorful, fluffy they come in different sizes because the are made in house and hand made. They come with a scoop of cream cheese. I would recommend this if you looking something fast and yummy.  Two bagels and one breakfast meal with two coffees $21.72

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry bagel and half of the three eggs and hashbrowns.  We shared.
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry bagel is so big.

7GAUcEP3tU6vSenUm0v0-w.text: Staff: attentive, chatty, nice, seem passionate about their place of work  Food: hit the damn spot, so tasty,  Coffee: actually brewed with some flavor. Not basic drip. Atmosphere: homey

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

27bXa9nxxIibFAKDdiOV7g.text: I really like this place.  The workers are very friendly.  The bagels are solid (not quite NYC, but hey, this is Vegas), and the cream cheeses are superb.  The egg & cheese bagel is quite good.  So are the fried potatoes.  This is clearly a place that locals patronize, so it does not feel ridiculously touristy like those on the Strip.  The prices are very reasonable too.  The coffee is nothing to write home about, and is unfortunately only served in large styrofoam cups.  Come for the bagels, not the coffee!

181UibRIo0OVmrWMu3BWPg.text: YES!! Now this is a bagel!! WOW!! Coming from NY I am vet picky when it comes to my bagels and the bagels here are absolutely baked to perfecting. I kept it simple with the sesame style and it was DELICIOUS! The cream cheese was soft and really good too. I got my bagel toasted and I just cannot speak highly enough to how amazing it was.   Now the pricing for most of the items on their menu was too rich for min good but my bagel and schmear was only $3!! For the quality of the bagel and spread, $3 was a steal!!!

kUQr5FW5y2qzQEpaNYyq5g.text: Where do I begin! This place is amazing. Food was fresh and delicious, portions were huge, coffee was fresh brewed! Upbeat atmosphere... everyone was friendly and genuinely cared for their customers! This is now our go to place for breakfast/lunch and bagels! Shout out to Dennis for great service and to the management!

R_Pv5TugYKoqPpAEfHYF5g.text: Just an awesome lunch. Pastrami piled high on in house made rye. Awesome food and service with fresh pastry for desert.

XI0DRF17oEZY696wC5C1sA.text: Terrible Bagel. Like Antonio this place has gone down hill since it was sold. Manager is more interested in his friends than the long time customers. Same new owners as pink box donuts. It was sold to Siegel  more than 1 year ago. Owners Stephen and Judy Siegel, Michael crandel , Sean theuson their in house attorney. Same mo as pink box sued the previous owner. It doesn't cost them anything to sue only a few hundred dollars for court fees. They try to shake people down for money. A bunch of scam artist. Check the internet. They layer their llc's to hide the fact that they own business and properties. I read how they tried to overcharge a customer for cookies. Watch carefully the weight and prices that they ring up on the register. Be careful like  Frank r said the bagel is nothing like a New York Bagel  Very poor taste and quality

4JGxnj5iL94CFK3fQ0kmKQ.text: OMG. The bagels here are incredible! I had the lox plate with an everything bagel and chive cream cheese. Every bite was fabulous. My daughter had a blueberry bagel with strawberry cream cheese, she loved it so much. Word of warning to parents, the cream cheese comes on the side. My kid was eating it by the toddler fistful.   The service here was also very attentive, but not in a smothering way. Our server was so sweet to our daughter, which was a nice surprise.

R2wscW3ctnVZuppRN5F-jA.text: This is by far the best deli in Las Vegas. The food was outstanding, the staff was excellent and the prices are very reasonable. This is a must for anyone wanting a True deli experience while in Las Vegas!!! Definitely will be back every time in town!!! Highly recommend!!!

5WMjfGuDgl4NXM3nFXPsbw.text: Now a few weeks ago, my request to find kreplach soup that I sent to the RJ's Taste of the Town in February, suddenly showed up in the newspaper!  Now, I never read newspaper tangiibly or online, but I happened to check it and see my request, 8 months later.  The truth is, as everyone can see here, I found kreplach soup in town back in May.  I had not been back to Harrie's since my first trip because whenever I think to go there, it is after their 3 PM closing time.  However, this weekend I felt miserable, and decided the only way to recuperate was to get kreplach soup.  Eric R. and I happened to have planned on lox and bagels for breakfast, so I decided to get a half dozen bagels there too.  I walked in, grabbed a bottled Dr. Brown's black cherry, and at the counter I declared with passion, "Give me the largest container of kreplach soup you have!"  The lady smiled and pointed to a big to go container, and I waved my hand and exclaimed, "PERFECT!"  Then I proceeded to order a half dozen bagels for Eric R. and a small cream cheese (he had the Tofutti one in the fridge but I think he really wanted the real deal so I surprised him).  In the end, I came home and had a giant bowl of kreplach soup accompanied by bagel chips, then some lox (aka brain food), whipped out some capers and sliced onion for Eric R., and saved the other half of the soup to get me through today.  A combination of Harrie's kreplach soup, Eric R.'s furnishing me with love and kleenex, and benadryl have nursed me back toward normalcy.

jQq656e00JOr4Mi5pzDY8A.text: Totally 5 stars all the way.  I'm only giving 4 stars because I love that it's a cool locals spot and a higher star rating would flood the place...  everything every time is phenomenal.  I highly recommend the pumpernickel bagel toasted with cream cheese.  Classic American diner, love it.

2Vbs-RuFBM2tdbDZ7og_cQ.text: So great!! Such a hidden surprise. We both ordered bagels and the potatoes and it was awesome. Rosa was our server and she was such a delight. Highly recommend!

iCA9J0ZaolxwrzJNV7ThyA.text: Without question,  a little known secret in Vegas for a fabulous breakfast! The M-F breakfast special has gone up in price over the years, but at $7.99 it is still worth it! Three eggs with your choice of bacon or sausage, potatoes, and bagel of your choice! The eggs are real, the bacon is thick and salty, the potatoes are freshly diced and scrambled to a nice crispness, and the bagels are made in house and a variety of around 15! It's in a old strip building a few blocks from The Strip and really only known by the locals. Over the 10 years I've been faithfully visiting Harries, it's a sketchy neighborhood with a couple of bookies sitting in the back! There's always a cop presence in the joint and if the bookies aren't entertaining enough, you'll occasionally see a crack head walk by the front! It all adds to the ambiance of a old Vegas deli joint that's stood the test of time and still has the characters visit that kinda framed what Vegas used to be in a time gone by! This southern gentleman will continue to visit in hopes to continue to see a Vegas of time gone by!

BfjrAi9A_SYhcroSxaDHCg.text: Bagels were outstanding (best in Vegas). Wait staff was solid. Eggs were horrible (tasted like imitation eggs). Order accordingly.

igrEczruRKFAytaH4eD1rg.text: Fantastic salami and onion omelette with cinnamon raisin bagels.  It's a a couple of years since I have been to Bagelmania. The neighborhood which was never great seems worse, but Bagelmania is definitely worth it!!!

zgApPAi3pHeNJv86qIfvLg.text: Not bad.  Bagels were amazing and the only reason to really go.   The soup was okay but not that great.   The matzah balls were a bit hard.   Definitely a good bagel place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

phlJiHxe8Cbn9dncrjaQGQ.text: Bf's family supposedly always comes here when they're in Vegas, so we got breakfast here before we left last weekend. I wasn't in the mood for bagels, so I ordered the eggs benedict -- that's my mistake right there. Who goes to a place with "bagel" in the name and orders something other than a bagel? The hollandaise sauce was just tooooo much. Too thick, but not really creamy. The potatoes that came with were also a little dry and overcooked.  Not a terrible place in the least, but I've just had better elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8t_yqK2A_VZ1at8QHjUwyQ.text: This  is a very good Jewish style deli.  Finding a decent bagel outside the NY area has been a challenge. My husband tried chicken in the pot. The portion was very generous, and came with a matzoh ball and kreplach. I ordered a bagel and lox. The bagel could have been softer, but the nova lox was very fresh and high quality. The egg cream was very authentic, and one of the best I've ever had. The service was very good. Our waitress was friendly and the owner checked to see if we were enjoying our food. If you are looking for a quick bite for lunch or breakfast, I would recommend this restaurant.

d40VVx7TQnV2JpO6rlYIWw.text: Best bagels I've ever had.  And the breakfasts?  Huge and delicious!  The surroundings are a little down market, but that is more than made up for by the quality of the food and the friendly service!

94a8ZrVjvOjC0UjIiwzLiA.text: Hole in the wall bagel shop that seems to have been plucked off the streets of queens ny circa 1968.  Stuck in time perfectly.  Great New York style bagels lox and all the trimmings. No lookers here and if you're under 30 you'll likely be half the age of most of your fellow diners.  Come for the food and ignore the demilitarized zone neighborhood.   One of the best breakfasts and values in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nmvba4UmfISnueC5Vw2F6Q.text: Came here on Christmas to grab some breakfast. I have to say its not in the greatest part of town but that didn't deter us. We needed bagels and bagels is what we had. So far this has been the closest to an east coast bagel I have personally had here in town. Cream cheese was great too. Service was friendly and quick and we will be back soon.

3ufDeZgaOTlrO2J__pfFsQ.text: I just left Harrie's and I inhaled a delicious lox and cream cheese on a bagel. I'm from NY and I am very particular about the heavenly rings of yeasty goodness. To my relief, these bagels were delicious! Everyone was nice and I was very happy with the super friendly customer service.  So, to that yelper -Hollie C. below, you are an insane racist and your review is disgusting.

X7ZReOLCOP5V5f-IiCwO-A.text: Really nice, warm staff. The best bagels we've ever had. Huge breakfast portion sizes. Would definitely recommend it. If I didn't have limited check in space would have brought a dozen back home!

TeNzrwX7e7xcJHhX7VHRJQ.text: Bagelmania IS DEFINITELY one of the best real Jewish delicatessen deli's you will find in Vegas. It is just east of the strip in a semi questionable part of town, but anytime I go in its filled with older folks who eat brunch on Tuesdays while the rest of the town is hustling. Definitely takes me back East everytime I walk in.  Amazing food guys -  seriously good food, great portions, moderately priced for the quality. I will gladly pay for quality food that was obviously made with love.  Typical deli with bulk meats, they cook their own corned beef among other things. They have awesome hardy breakfast options as well as sandwiches and entres. They have a case full of salads and sides, the bagels are fresh daily (obviously) they even have the Italian cookies you pay by the pound (I believe), just like back east!  Take an hour and stop by here for breakfast or lunch, or pick up some damn good fresh bagels for your office, you will not regret it. And I'll bet you will be back!

OmcFnQg8L-Q9HKGrThcPBg.text: Although locals may understandably grouse about paying close to $15 for a nova bagel, we Angelenos have been paying such tribute at the Langer's Deli altar for decades. yelp.com/biz/langers-los... The comparison is apt, because Langer's is also in a part of town not hitherto known for its culinary excellence. Also apt, because both places have the same sort of quaint Aunt Enid-like "sit down and eat, Bubbeleh, you look skin and bones" type of feel. But where Langer's has lines down the block and has been designated a cultural heritage site, this place is still somewhat fledgling, although I did see a Bentley and a Maybach during my 20 minute stay on a weekday morning, so surely they aren't far from stardom. The bagels here are legit, yo, and the nova salmon sublime. So too, the Russian Tea cake cookies, which are melt-in-the mouth delicious.

URQqwUZU_ZVa0zZ5mFimRQ.text: The waitstaff at Bagelmania is friendly and hardworking. The food is okay but expensive for Vegas. Two people should plan to spend $35-40 for a regular breakfast. The real problem is the restaurant itself. It needs a complete remodel or they should relocate. If you're ODC like me, a visit to the restroom will ruin your appetite. There's one tiny dingy unisex restroom located not far from the kitchen with poor ventilation. The seating area of the restaurant is old, but well lit and clean. The back near the restroom has narrow hallways, is darker and feels dirty. I'll only go back if they renovate and clean it up. Overall the place is overrated.

wvfs3B9tCP6wAdoLbeMaPA.text: Harrie's Bagelmania is a great little breakfast place, in an area of town you would want to generally stay away from, except Harrie's is in a shopping plaza.  It's a Jewish inspired menu, and the bagels are easily the best I have had in Vegas.  Also, on Tuesdays, they sell a dozen bagels for dirt cheap...I think maybe $5?  This morning I had the breakfast special of 3 huge eggs, fried perfectly, a slab of ham, a mound of hash browns, and a sesame bagel.  We also got a potato pancake - I'm not a connoisseur of potato pancakes, but Harrie's are awesome.  Service is pretty good, but they always make sure your coffee or iced tea are filled.    Plan ahead, because Harrie's is cash only.

QZoJONS688ccEXJwSP6N9g.text: Old school Vegas that has incredible bagels.  U can't go wrong here for taste or price.  Service is excellent too.  I love the place

GkGirJLY4WeEJE9nP2OEMg.text: All I could think about from the moment I woke up was, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?". While getting ready for the gym, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?". While at the gym, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?". After the gym, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?".  Well, hello Harrie's Bagelmania. I have had you bookmarked for well over six months. Thank you cravings that would put a pregnant woman to shame. When I want a certain food, let no one get in my way.   The service is quick and efficient. As I walked through the door, the busperson already had ice water and menu in hand and was walking to my table. Two minutes later, the waitress took my order. 5-10 minutes and my Nova Lox and Everything Bagel was out. I had ordered the Fresh Fish Platter For One ($14.99). My unsalted salmon came with a scoop of either plain or chive cream cheese, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, and olives. The chive cream cheese uses fresh chopped greens. The everything bagel was chewy and possessed an amalgamation of all their savory components. On top of that, not only did I have enough of ingredients to dress two half bagels, but top the extra veggies with salmon. With each order, there was six strips of the fatty fish. I am thankful because recently I have become a garbage disposal.   The restaurant was half packed and the staff was able to finish my meal in half an hour. It is a great place for a quick breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Platter for one nova lox and everything bagel ($14.99)

6gkNU3sO6XVDNhJMk-LYuA.text: Excellent deli short drive from the strip. Salami and egg breakfast was excellent. Bagels are top notch. Please note cash only. Update they now take credit cards via 4square.

PJz4ccFc63xjmkMN_wfmxg.text: The bagels are excellent!!! Everyone there is very nice as well. My cup of coffee is never even close to being empty. The guy that runs around with water and coffee is on it!! And he is super polite! I was born in New York and grew up eating awesome bagels and these are the only ones like that in Vegas. I did order the eggs Benedict once and did not like it at all. But bagels are their specialty, so I understand. The hollandaise was grainy. Another time they made me an egg white omelet with spinach and mushrooms it was delicious! Plus it came with a bagel and I got fruit instead of home fries, so great options. Yesterday I tried their beef barley soup and it was pretty tasty came with bagel chips. Very reasonable prices as well!! I'm so happy I found this place!

C3sYC2biuXsjpQ0GS6Gqzw.text: What wonderful bagels they make! Lunch was excellent also. I ordered a cup of lentil soup and a side of sour cream. Add the bagel crisps that came with it, and I had a satisfying lunch not involving meat. My companion had the half pastrami sandwich/cup of cabbage soup combo and ate every bite. The place doesn't accept credit cards but has an ATM in the corner for those without the green.

S3rV0OLUyfP6pnAWSGpVfA.text: This place has been my hangout for 20 years! I have smoked over 34 million cigarettes here, held business meetings, lived through 4 owners (outlived actually) and the transition to non-smoking has slowed me down but not stopped me. Maybe I'll quit.  The food is good and totally authentic. Yes, old Jewish weirdos and gangstas abound (including me). Be sure to go there or your life will never be quite complete....

3qJOn-w-WtBjTinoVmmuKg.text: They have the best bialys and bagels ever.  After breakfast my husband and I took home chopped liver, a kasha knish, and creamed herring.  When we asked for extra onions in the herring the owner told the cook to weigh the herring first then add the onions so we wouldn't be charged more for the addition.  Very nice.  We will definitely be back for more.

enB8L76CIhU6-Z1im_eGrg.text: My first trip to Harrie's.  Enjoyed the food, and the service was good.  I had a tuna melt, and chicken soup.  It was all good, and the portions were huge.  Easy to get to location, with ample parking, at least when we went.  Would go again for food when in the neighborhood.

4a3JKMT2F1zkpOvthyvEoQ.text: The Real Deal.  Real bagels - no shortcuts - at least 15 kinds.  And all the traditional toppings/spreads.  Bialys. All kinds of sandwiches, salads, soups...  Made from scratch.  Noodle kugel with raisins!  3 kinds of knish - kasha (outstanding), potato, and meat (I've only had the kasha).  Fried matzo, blintzes, potato pancakes...  Lox, nova, kreplach, schmaltz - all available here.  All of the regular breakfast offerings plus a million choices for lunch.  Super-friendly people! (thanks Nancy!)  They also cater. Open daily 6:30 am to 3pm. Within walking distance of The Strip.  Just say No to nasty casino rubber bagels and GO HERE.

tq-MiMAMxdUEMeiEhLBFWA.text: Many of their dishes are made from scratch, ingredients are generally-speaking fresh. Best nova lox you can get without going to a high-end eatery. Essentially you are going for the food and nothing else.   Service and prep are ABYSMAL. As my party puts it, "there is an issue every time." The customer will principally deal with this middle-aged, portly blonde woman that works the counter who is weary of her surroundings, humorless, and completely devoid of personality. I have yet to be waited on by anyone else. It takes her forever to ring up an order, details need to be confirmed and re-confirmed to ensure she's understanding you, and sizes/portions may still be wrong. She is not proficient with the credit card swiper and seems borderline offended that anyone would even vaguely consider paying that way. Suggestions emerge as gentle nudges, pushing you into food specials that actually cost more to the customer thanks to their portioning. When you get your food, assuming you ordered a bagel, the cream cheese is slathered on so haphazardly that its spread is reminiscent of the Ocean Spray logo. You actually need to re-do the work of the line cook and spread it again.   Prices are disgusting. $10-15 after taxes for a bagel and lox (more expensive than NY, NY which is FAR better). $2.60 for a 10-12 oz beverage. Fountain drinks? Obligatory largest size. Good luck fitting it in your cupholder. Come on.

JoUYjI-LlQAIDxZbIw2ywA.text: Possibly one of three best bagels and breakfast places ever... It may me a little hard to find but so worth it... The bagels leave New York bagels in the dust and everything from the sausage to the eggs is delicious. Great service and great people.... I would make the drive from LA every morning to eat here.  After having breakfast for en entire week in Vegas at all the top hotels I found a place that actually tastes good.

D8XjY9qzY13iBcspqdAI5w.text: Mindblowing.  That is the word for this fantastic breakfast joint waaay off the old and hackneyed Vegas Strip. Freshly made bagels, tasty cream cheeses, and lots of coffee... what else do you need to start off your day?  If you happen to be a freak and don't like bagels, Harrie's also serves tons of other breakfast dishes, from eggs to pancakes to french toast. I can't speak for those because I devoured half their bagels over two breakfasts there.  Bonus points for friendly service - I left my phone on the table and one of the wait staff came over and handed it back to me as I was leaving.

vd8qUXrsQpGAxGsCCWFNEQ.text: Delicious super platter (lox, sable, and whitefish, plain and scallion cream cheese, plus 3 bagels.) I even got a fourth, salt, which was quite nice with the right amount of salt and poppy seeds. Too much for the three of us to eat but we stumbled away happy and stuffed to the gills.

18YJnEOGakBSWpWfmvxrxQ.text: Best chicken in a pot ever.The bagels are also fantastic. Service is wonderful.

57iVqL4sJFVR_0CAGpvzcg.text: Good bagels, decent service, good portions. Corned beef hash was a major disappointment. Flavorless and mushy. How is it possible to make corned beef flavorless? Even salt and Tabasco didn't help. If it's homemade, they need to start from scratch. If it's from a can, they need a new supplier. I never send food back unless it's undercooked, but if we hadn't been on the move, I would have returned this for something else.

eoRHuhFcmsxee345mkmkUA.text: Just visiting Vegas and found Harrie's on Yelp. It was just as advertised: a great local spot in the ghetto with delicious breakfast bagels and a deli. The place was full of regulars that the employees knew by name, a nice change from being with all the tourists on the Vegas strip. I had an "everything" breakfast bagel with egg, bacon, and cheese. It was hot, perfectly toasted and yummy. Coffee was not bad, not the best I've ever had but decent and served in nice blue mugs. The service was fast and friendly. And they had an awesome New York mural on the wall to look at while we ate. They take cash only so plan ahead. Definitely going back to check out the deli next time I am in town.

f3dxicYpZQCbi3wpT0sneA.text: What a lovely little gem. Perfect for a quick to go meal on the way to the Grand Canyon. Food delicious and service perfect. Even filled our camelbacks!

8NFKdizWP5kkKmbd8YdvZQ.text: I went to Harries exactly four times since moving to Las Vegas. The fact that it is in a ghetto is scary, even in daylight, but the reward of a good bagel made me forget about the neighborhood. Each time I went there, I took advantage of the Tuesday special. The first time they only had three ET's (my favorite), so I had to add a few others to round out the dozen. I was told that you can get exactly the mix you want if you call on Monday. So I call on Monday and order 12 Whole Wheat ET bagels. They said that this was a special order and I would have to prepay it (cash). I was told I would still get the Tuesday special price. So my wife drives 30 minutes to prepay the special price and is informed that it is a special order and the Tueday price does not apply. She then drives 30 minutes back home. I drove on Tuesday to pick up the order and asked why I was required to pay the normal price, because 'special orders' are not included in the special price, that is their policy (even though their facebook page say ALL bagels are cheaper on Tuesday) . Okay, That is their policy. I am new in town and I must learn these things. The third time I ordered 9 Whole Wheat and 3 Bialys. The WW bagels were good and I added my own 'everything mix' to them. The bialys were rolls shaped like real bialys with a dab of onion in the center, nothing like Kossar's Bialys!  The fourth time I placed an order the owner took my order, name and phone number, as was usual. What was unusual is that they did not have the order ready when I got there, so I just told the clerk, "just give me 12 Whole Wheat". She opens the bag and is intercepted by the owner who says, "No bagels for him". The owner then tells me she has the right to refuse service to any undesirable customers. "I refuse service to you. Goodbye" I asked why and she said I insulted her help (which I would never do).  I left, never to return. If she wanted to refuse service to me, why did she take the order? She could have saved me an hour trip. She wanted to inconvenience me. She is a very mean woman who offered no evidence of my behavior except her word. Enjoy the bagel place in the ghetto.

2qRYHdo8yumTjPp2RMpJ2g.text: Great service and great value .  Mish Mosh soup was outstanding.  I just wish they were open in the evenings.

klzS0beGqZoYmUgOfbRh0g.text: A little pricey except for the Bagelwich (the best deal in all of vegas)!  But it is all really good and a great neighborhood breakfast and lunch joint.

OfMmx3nng2HVLAqIL5p_kg.text: What can I say, Harrie you did it again! This is the second time I have dined on Harrie's as close as it gets to the east coast bagels on the west coast, well in Las Vegas at least. From potato knish to pumpernickel bagel Harries has me all vacklempt. Crisp on the outside soft on the inside, slight bagel chewyness without giving you lock jaw. O' what a bagel. It has been a long time since I had an everything bagel, and harrie you brought me back in time to old New york school days of my usual everything bagel breakfast. These bagels even hold up for a few days so order a dozen. Shalom harrie!!

H5gnYeBYGOtbHaOIbeDQ4w.text: The bagel was good. Lots of bagel options to choose from. It's hard to find a place open at 7am in Vegas. Wished staff was more friendly.

9FHFMtGSc5nSpJD3vAu39g.text: Love love LOVEEEEE Harries,I mean from the fresh baked bagels to the exceptional tasting Bialys I guarantee that you cannot go wrong with this place! Having years & years of experience with the way that they present fresh breakfasts and lunches,Bagelmania certainly doesn't disappoint! The neighborhood of course could use a little TLC,but I can assure you that it has absolutely no comparison to the restaurant and its staff. Everyone here is always so nice to me please do yourself a favor and stop by soon,you will NOT regret it.

CGg2LKlg0ER7DO3WbncgKA.text: Real NY style bagels. Better than Noah's/Einsteins. Noah's was good before purchased by Einstein's, now they are just round loaves of Bread with no bagel consistency. If you know bagels and love real bagels, Harry's BAGELMANIA is the place to go.    Richard Gertler  NYC  This is where I get bagels when I visit Vegas.

qOiuBgF1E-MZTRO_8rkcxw.text: This place isn't bad. It has traditional breakfast and bagel food and has apparently been a staple to the area for a while. Personally I wasn't impressed. The fresh squeezed OJ was ok, The Nova and eggs was very salty. The bialy wasn't great (had others in town much better). The corned beef hash I had wasn't bad. All in all it was fair. Only thing I wanted seconds on was the coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash &amp; eggs

3rW5hGkqZRFuFhJ58IjsdA.text: This place is terrible and deserves no stars except the server was very nice a younger lady.The matzo ball soup was tasteless and the carrots were hard.The Kasha Knish was hard and had no taste and was dry.The potato pancake was hard and burnt.The pastrami sandwich was small and poor quality mear.Everything was overpriced.On the way out i opened the door and the owner yelled at us and said you are letting out all the air conditioning.There were no other customers in this place besides us because it sucks.And to top it all off outside there were crackheads and bums begging for money.this restaurant is in the ghetto and you take your life in your hands going in there

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt food and small portions
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d3BRGfA9MpuouOoGmU4kCw.text: Been having these since I can remember!! Very delicious bagels! Made from scratch! I suggest to try various because they're all delicious  local spot , indeed.

SrInHSKRKFTC03kebOHWcw.text: Finally got to try this bagel place when I was back in Vegas doing maintenance. The bagels are the real deal, 4.5 star but not the best in town. Bagel cafe off of Buffalo is better for sure. So if you live on the westside or Summerlin you really don't need to bother coming to Harrie's besides to just check it out. The bagels have high gluten and a thick chewy crust, just like they are supposed to. Too crunchy though. If you leave them out for any bit of time in the desert air they become very hard very quickly. This place is an old school deli. It reminds me of a bagel deli I used to go in Fort Lauderdale when I lived in Florida.

lTMbdNbl8sdeWZ1NcJNmnQ.text: Been here several times before it is a True staple of this side of Vegas Anthony was fabulous waiter very pleasant and fun the food isn't anything to really scream about if you're a local and a regular than you love it

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tnPGGLghISPVT51S3vHo_g.text: Harrie's is less than a mile from my condo, but that's not why I come here at least one Sunday Morning per month: It's everything!  From service to food it's consistently (for decades) perfect. It's bagels, cream cheese & lox for me! Ok. It's in the hood. So what. We're talking Jewish soul food. Potato pancakes are the bomb. Matzoh Ball soup is better than what Grandma made. Lox & onion omelette. Mmm. So if you're in the mood for kosher style deli this is the place.

rmGHC6Y55wD_e1Jk9ZmI2Q.text: Fantastic food, service and all around a great place to eat.  Best Bagels in Vegas!

J1Yf5Qo0YxQpKgUgxW3-lg.text: Second time going to this place the first time they were really slow, the second time I ordered my order 20minutes ago I just got there it was supposed to be ready in 10 minutes (prior to my arrival)and they hadn't even started making my order yet I am so unpleased with this place they are rude and don't seem to like their jobs pretty much. Never again!!!

kvaBoWiMhBGCGU84M7UErg.text: I have come to this place for many years and I always come back because the food and the service is wonderful but these last two times the service was very bad that really made me very sad because it was one of my favorite places:((

TaY-LYpWC3YUlgXncy-Lyw.text: Omg! The Ruben omelette was straight up bomb.com! If you are a Reuben fan, then this is the omelette for you! I got it with pastrami and loved it. It's also served with corned beef. The staff is super friendly too. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k5UZ34jm7lJHQsh-nQT4dg.text: The bagels where great. The service was not. We waited closed to 20 minutes in a nearly empty restaurant for our bagels. Just bagels. Toast them. Bring them to the table. That's it. We also waited for menus. Then waited for the check. Then waited to pay. Bring something to read and enjoy the bagels!

G8mEwhsXGtYNYOsZY9fyAg.text: Om nom nom - stopped here on our way out of Vegas. Hubby and I are bagel aficionados, these were authentic, chewy, fresh, and a perfectly healthy amount of cream cheese. So worth the 10-minutes-out-of-our-way drive! Don't do Einstein, do Harrie's!

WUDEX33Xxv9S14mQwRFUdw.text: If I'm on my way to, or from the sports book at LVH (yes I will still call it that lol) or heading to Chinatown from Henderson I pass this place often. I've had it bookmarked a while and decided to finally give this place a try. When I'm in the area I usually keep driving because you never know what you'll get in this. Located in the ever so famous crack alley this place isn't a place you think you would enjoy or have high hopes for outside of yelp just looking in from the outside, but enough about the lovely area this place is actually quite good if you look past the exterior. When a waffle place close by had no seats I looked into my bookmarks and saw harries was close so we stopped by on a Sunday around noon.   First impression the place is a bit dated and could use a makeover. The carpet was a bit grungy and the tables looked like the came from the 70's. I decided I was going to stay and let the food do the talking. I already knew I wanted lox and a bagel. Nova is the less salty version and there's a few options to choose from. I went with the burton 1-2-3, almost like the platter but with less nova. My handsome decided on the three fer. Which has a knish (your choice of meat or potato) a potato pancake, and a cheese blintz. The nova was fresh, not too salty. I had it on an onion bagel with cream cheese. I added capers as my plate didn't come with them. I thoroughly enjoyed my nova and bagel with schmear. The three fer plate was enough for just the two of us to share but we both shared both our plates. The knish was loaded with brisket and the postal pancake was crispy and savory. Our server was friendly and our food came out in good time. I also took home some rugelach. Yes I just googled the spelling. Little pastries with Apple and raspberry filling. They also have chocolate but chocolate is not my thing. I would come back here and try some more jewish staples. The challah French toast looks nommy as well as the kreplach. Unil next time Harries. Shalom!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three Fer. Knish with brisket, potato pancake and cheese blintz. Sour cream and applesauce.
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burtons 1-2-3. Nova with bagel goodies to pile on with. I added capers.

nnBSPh9ThuMZBtFFDo7Jdg.text: My favorite bagel shop in Las Vegas. Whenever we come to Vegas to play we stop at Harries to get my favorite salt bagel with vegetable cream cheese. My mouth is watering writing this review.  They have excellent breakfast too. I love the salami and eggs. The service is  good and the servers are always friendly. The prices are very reasonable. It's really close to the Strip but the area is a tad shady but we have never had a problem.

tJTQbQA3CpksEeqOax7JBA.text: Unfortunately I do not get to this side of town too often, otherwise it would be my regular breakfast spot.  Bagel mania is the real deal, if you love NY/Jewish deli's then Bagelmania is your place. Moving from Los Angeles I missed my Canters's & Jerry's deli. The cookies are also awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bagel sandwich

LyR4JYVZaWTTpQfJlN-UbA.text: Great New York style bagels. It reminds me of a Mom and Pop shop in any East Coast city. The prices are great and the service is amazing. The coffee outstanding!

9eJqVZTTB7z6VxEmhfkfIA.text: I thought I would not find a great bagel place in Las Vegas but my husband's friend, Uncle Bert, recommended us this place. Thanks Uncle Bert. They make matzah brei for breakfast here. My husband ordered his with salami and I had bialy and fresh lox. The lox was "goodly-fresh" and bialy was a match. Our waitress was friendly and knew ahead what we needed to go with our meals. Matzah brei was ok but I'd prefer without the salami. The portion of the brei was quite big. The price is not that cheap for people in the area (I think) but I guess the place is for tourists? Not sure. But lox is not that cheap everywhere either. K, enough complain! *:)
