Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bialy and lox plate - my plate!

yj1sSjVQ6MCOGHewVsfLmw.text: Love this place!!! The staff (family owned) are so friendly and personable. The food is amazing, especially the bagels. Nice, quaint bagel shop, where locals and regulars come. The neighborhood seems kinda sketchy but I promise you this is a place you gotta go to eat.

l6kNYhC5ataAhzyAizWlcA.text: bagel with cream cheese and side of nova lox salmon. just plain excellent tried the corned beef tasted like prepackaged deli. okay, but not on par with the bagels and salmon.  pumpernickel bagel stood out.  thought all the staff were very cordial  the best pizza in vegas Is DI GIOURNO'S FROZEN THIN CRUST.  reason has to be the hard water makes all bread products diminished in taste--- but these bagels overcame

dhA6XDTMCuBe-4h3iQNwTQ.text: Not all bagels are created equal. This is the closest we have found to a proper Eastcoast Bagel - our go to lunch is to share the bagel with lox and have it open faced so we each get a proper half.

mjYu2kQKo3v2jC5qE9Tq0Q.text: Great place! Large (and delicious) bagels with great cream cheese. The cherry short bread cookies are amazing, as are the shortbread cookies covered in chocolate and sprinkles.

5_DmmT4bldwYTI-XbvzTTA.text: My fiance and I had a breakfast bagel (bacon,egg, and cheese) and it was even better than our favorite NYC bagel place!!!! We will definitely be back!

tHy3Vicv0YtZpyKZew-Uuw.text: The worst! My mother has eaten here before and thought it would be a nice place for a mother daughter breakfast date. My mother even said she would go to this place just for their coffee.  After this morning, We will never set foot in this establishment again. I would have recommended it before to friends and family but not after this morning.  I ordered the 3 eggs with I thought the hash browns and a side of fruit. My mom ordered the BLT with a side of hash browns and extra mayo.  I received my eggs and a cup of fruit, when I asked where the hash browns were the waiter informed me that he substituted them with the fruit. I said I wanted the hash browns with a side of fruit. We told him we had no problem paying extra for the hash browns.   My mother went to eat her hash browns and they were so salty, you wanted to ask if the lid fell off when seasoning the hash browns. Her sandwich consisted of a slice of tomato, one piece of lettuce and about 6 slices of bacon. No mayo... there was a cup on my plate with what looked like mayo (turned out to be butter).   Then came the tipping point, after eating my eggs (still didn't have my hash browns) I found a light colored hair buried in my fruit cup, of which I only ate 3 grapes. We both lost our appetite. Asked the guy for our check. He brought it over. Okay I ate most of my food so yes I should be charged, my mom barely took a bite out of her food. And they charged us $27.20. With what we ordered that is a very reasonable price. We didn't have a problem with the cost at all. However, the fact that my mom hadn't touched her food was another story.   So we went up to the registrar to talk to the Nancy. She told my mom that well she played with her food, so she has to pay for it. And I quote "Those who complain about the food complain about the price". Again nothing is wrong with their prices. So I asked if they charged extra for the hair in my fruit. She said there was no hair in your fruit. If their was it was your. Okay, so I have brown almost black hair and my mom has auburn hair. Neither of us have light hair. However, When I informed her that it was light colored, she said no one who worked their had light colored hair (guess she never looked in the mirror).   So in the end we paid almost $30 for 3 eggs, toast and two cups of coffee.

QQg74iVjaIdhMR51vX6Qfw.text: If you like deli food, this is the best place in Las Vegas.  Owned by the same people for many years, now new owners.  Still the same quality but even better in many instances.  The best (and only in Las Vegas) kasha knishes.  Potato ones are also great.  Everything from breakfast to lunch very good on a big menu.  Have had lox, corned beef, brisket, matzoh ball soup, kreplach chicken soup, baked salmon, etc.  All very good.  The bagels are also the best in town, too.  Prices are very reasonable and the staff are always friendly. Good location, near the convention center, UNLV, and not far from the strip. The place to go in Las Vegas!

-y2kpqNnxLGBFjqMwD5uxg.text: Discovered Harrie's when searching for bagels in Vegas and was super happy about it!  We headed in to grab breakfast and bagels and it was a great experience.  Breakfast was good, but the star was my bagel!   It is so hard to find REAL bagels and the egg bagel i had at Harrie's was the real deal!  SO HAPPY!  SO SAD I DON'T LIVE IN VEGAS!  So, the decor is bizarre and the place is kind of old and odd, but the staff is friendly and helpful and the service is fast and the food is good.  Then, pick up bagels and cream cheese on your way out for tomorrow.  I will absolutely be back and I've been telling everyone to go!  Now, thanks to Yvonne, I'm dying to try the egg salad and the pickles!!!  GO HERE.

hShWkjynV_nlaFz450iSIQ.text: One of the best places to have breakfast in Vegas! This delicacy has been here for many years, and you can bet that if you find yourself here for lunch or for breakfast, you will eat well at a reasonable price. Quality has never wavered.

yvGISeyMrd7Fzy8Hajtruw.text: Old school bagel shop in Vegas. Great food and great service. Will be coming here a lot going forward.

7nXlAcPrYFDWnvbiEYpiAg.text: Delicious, almost identical in taste to NYC bagels.  I always get the sesame, toasted with plain shmear. They are friendly, fast & accomodating too just like NY (toasted, light shnear, etc) shops. Great bagel, decent price.  The breakfasts look great too but haven't tried those yet.

a-0N8XBbHLiFkY6tkljLJw.text: Being from new york I was so excited to eat breakfast here this morning but if your Black do not expect a Warm greeting or hospitable service, the waitress was sooo dull no smile she almost seemed annoyed to serve my friend and I but the second a group of white people came in she was super nice to them. She never asked how was the food or did we need anything, or if we were done , she brought us the check and basically was telling us to leave , never asked if I wanted more coffee or anything, this has to be the worst dirtiest place ive ever been? To in my life!

SVFf3w84ZGl-T9IMDPA50Q.text: Got 3 bagels with cream cheese and one bagel with ham and egg to go.  You can sit down here but we didn't have time do we got our good to go.  All the bagels were great and the cream cheese galvirs were good as well.  The  bagels had loads of cream cheese.  The ham in the egg sandwich was a thick slab of ham.  Great bagels.  Easy parking which helps too.

UaDQAzp9gbRPJTTCPAMeQA.text: I have never written a bad review on Yelp - this will be my first one.  I have been coming to Harries Baglemania for about 10 years now, every April.  It was the first great Jewish Deli that I found in Las Vegas.  In my most recent trip, I saw that the old woman was no longer at the place.  I placed a simple order - a bagel lox and cream cheese, and a chicken soup - both always fantastic from Harries Baglemania.  Upon arriving back at my hotel, I discovered that there was no lox on the bagel, but lox spread.  I drove back to Harries, and they apologized, and replaced the sandwich.  Upon return to the hotel, we discovered that they were not using Nova Lox, but very salty plain lox (smoked salmon) which did not taste good (and was certainly not traditional).  In addition, the chicken soup was not using a real boiled chicken. I could clearly see that there were "chicken cubes" that looked like prepared chicken from a food service, as opposed to "grandma boiling up the chicken in the back of the store".   The fact that Harries was (and still is) a dump is part of the charm, if you are familiar with the old NY Jewish Deli's in New York (there are no "nice looking" real NY Deli's - they were all dumps, all built from struggling families) - but unfortunately, the "love" in the preparation of the food is no longer there. It's just a business for someone new.  With places like Bagel Cafe, and Canters both in Las Vegas, I will unfortunately be bringing my business elsewhere in the future.

q_riR0FS73NdhFFm_UJ73g.text: I always stop into Harry's when I need my Jewish Deli Fix. It's much close to me than Bagel Cafe and quite frankly almost as good. Today I stopped in for a Roast Beef & Cheddar on an Onion Roll. Everything is made from scratch, sliced roast beef, fresh baked roll, and the coffee is always fresh. You seat yourself and the waitress come over promptly and the food comes out quickly. I've had the pastrami breakfast plate as well and it's amazing. Fresh bagel and cream cheese for sale in ten way out which is a plus. It's not in the best neighborhood but it's not really that bad either. Definitely with the stop

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Sliced Roast Beef and Cheddar.

f0bj19C0zk8L2B22SvfuMg.text: when visiting vegas we always try to dine off strip and for breakfast, it was no exception. we came here on our way to the convention center and sat down for a hearty meal. yes, its a bagel shop which you can walk in, order and leave. but its a restaurant as well and you can sit and have a relaxing meal. you can tell its a local's place because most of the diners there look like they belong lol  i got the build your own omelet with spinach (no cheese), which comes with choice of fruit, cottage cheese or tomato slices ( i chose cottage cheese), and also comes your choice of bagel (i had the whole wheat) all for $8.99.  the portion was pretty generous and i actually couldnt finish it all and had to take the rest with me.   my beau had the salmon scrambler which i was able to taste as well and it was very good. that probably would have been my second choice.  overall, the food is good, the service was quick and the price is just right! btw, the new york neighborhood mural on the wall is pretty freakin awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My build your own omlete, with spinach, cottage cheese and whole wheat bagel $8.99

QCtUWwvkUlhG_Yfl_lhA_Q.text: Close by the Las Vegas Convention Center, it is as close to New York style bagelry you'll see in Vegas.  We stopped for breakfast-  - I ordered pumpernickel bagel with side of whitefish and cucumbers  - Two colleagues ordered fried egg and bacon sandwiches - 2 more colleagues ordered bagels with cream cheese and Lox  Everyone enjoyed their food! And prices were reasonable compared to hotels and casinos. We noticed local law enforcement officers there too so it is also a locals hangout.  I would definitely come back when back in Vegas for a conference.

9Zo22chpVf0JCOYLdt2dqA.text: The bagel was good, cream cheese was ok.  The prices are high and the money you are paying for is NOT going towards things like vacuuming the floor, cleaning the tables, the windows, the cases or the decor. God knows what is behind the scenes! I like dives, but this place was just plain dirty. Will get our bagels somewhere else.

tfGtPzM4JzQ3Z8VTJvd5xw.text: Stopped for breakfast yesterday morning based on the reviews. We were surprised that it was not busier. Our breakfast was OK. The service was a little sloppy. It took a while to get our drinks. My big complaint was that they did not have a restroom for customers. The waitress did sneak me back but it was hush hush. I thought it was a regulation that all full service food establishments must provide restrooms. I read the recent reviews this morning and saw that there are new owners. My suggestion to them is to make your place more customer friendly. You will not have a business without customers.

sLOCwROXeYE4Pv0qTHzQ9Q.text: Came in for a breakfast, bagel and smear.  Bagel was fresh and smear was generous.  All for under five dollars.  Highly recommended. Definitely better than anything on the strip.

MTHHvS0Tv5M2uI-eXrX_GA.text: We loved it here!  Was the best Matzo Ball soup, Rubens, and bacon in Las Vegas!  New ownership as of January so time will tell if they can keep up the quality.  Service this morning was lacking and we had to remind our waitress to provide silverware, the accompaniments for the potato pancake and refill our drinks.   Food was okay...  rubens we're a little more greasy than before.  We're willing to give it another try...  bagelwich was its usual excellence.

hyZp8EAx7L8DKJffhVIZMA.text: I eat here about three or four times a year, breakfast and lunch.  The prices are moderate for the amount and quality of food - it is Vegas.  The CB hash is always good and the daily specials, especially the chicken-in-a-pot are good.  Take some of the cookies home with you and a bag of bialis.

K2M8d49HK4ks_BqpMVloXA.text: Place was filthy. I read reviews and decided to give it a try. I wanted to eat some fresh bagels and to my disappointment and my husbands the place looked very unkept and just plain gross. My husband chose not to order anything since he got so grossed out with the dirtiness of the establishment. I would never go back again. Bagels wasn't the best I've had.

9t4DNZo51LGqC451Bc_jdg.text: go to this place! It has such great breakfast  the bagels seem homemade and everything was incredible. It's "closeish" to the strip, but not on the strip. The breakfast was huge!

wZ462IQZeOQfml92UKpb9w.text: This is a great deli to eat at in LV. The food is always fresh and of quality. Since I discovered this hidden jewel several months ago it's been a frequent eating stop; never had a bad meal. The deli bagels are the best and deli product is great! A must come to place to eat!

_n1L_IktxecaQZCxodvKHQ.text: thanks fellow yelpers for a great find. was looking for something casual and quick for breakfast and didn't want to have to hunt for parking at a casino restaurant. plus, i'm always on the lookout for a good bagel, so harrie's came up on my search.  pretty big menu of deli/diner selections, lots of omelets, scrambles, sandwiches, salads, soups, etc. i had the corned beef hash and eggs, which came with breakfast potatoes and a bagel w/cream cheese. food was served piping hot and was outstanding. hash was tasty and not overloaded with grease as can happen.  had an onion bagel, tasted as "east coast" as i've had on the west coast. for a frame of reference, my favorite ny bagels are h&h... not sure how native new yorkers would rate those, but i love 'em. absolutely hate noah's bagels. can't wait to dig into the plain (always a measure of how good a bagel joint is) and the bialy i brought home.  highly recommend harrie's for a casual, off strip breakfast or lunch with a decidedly local flavor. i'm disappointed i hadn't heard of this place sooner... it will be a must visit whenever i'm in lv.   as others have noted, the neighborhood is a bit dodgy, but i wouldn't let that stop me from visiting. cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hoppel Poppel - eggs, salami, peppers, onions, potatoes
Photo of Bagelmania - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs

J0duIcAHclKpme8PDFSWfw.text: If you are looking for a wide variety of halva this is the place.  They had a whole wheel of marble as well as 6 different kinds of Joyva.  Great lox, cookies, cream cheeses and of course, bagels.  Get a dozen on Tuesdays for $5.99.  A great place to recall a by-gone era.

R-lJ3ulv5vfPs_o77NZdfw.text: Way overpriced. Ironically, in a bad neighborhood. The price range is incorrect, it's NOT "Under $10". Under $10 you can get some tiny side but that's it.

FoV_8mwuGbh87EREqzUO6g.text: For a full year i make the drive from mountains edge to the eastside ( office bldg next to Lindo on DI ) - sometimes i take the 215/airport route, other times the 15 / spring mtn ; During that time i drove by Harrie's at least 100+ times and i never tried.  I move to my westside office last month and now i've tried harrie's twice ... go figure  first visit - standard breakfast - 3 eggs over, sausage patties, everything bagel toasted.  solid - priced a little on the high side given the zip code but overall, i like the place.  2nd visit - lunch - get the turkey/pastrami/swiss and thousand island on rye with the mac salad ( homemade ) - again, decent sammie - a little pricey for what you get ( $11.50 ) and for the mac salad being "homemade" it sure had that bucket-o-salad taste to it.  If i'm in the area and need some breakfast or lunch, i'll definitely re-visit.  pics added

2J_NX9qPEiTVOVTUjcJyVQ.text: This place is great. Bagels are yummy. The soup is great. The location is not good at all but still a great spot.

_3ARuMNAzBt8J3Fnz8XdAw.text: Reminds me of a NJ bagel shop more than any other place I have found in Vegas. A bacon, egg and cheese on a well-made bagel (with real eggs and crispy bacon) seems to be a rarity on the West coast but they have them here for $4.50. I have found breakfast sandwiches like that elsewhere, on crappy bagels, for upwards of $7 (really!) Also tried the corned beef (lean) on rye (too many caraway seeds) which was good and the matzoh ball soup which was also good but could have used some actual chicken. I'll be back for sure, though. Also, they have special discounts on bagels, corned beef and pastrami on Tuesdays. Bring cash, no credit cards accepted.

G7tf2Uh44H0HmNbm6zQxxw.text: Their Bagels are the best in Las Vegas. REal water bagels. Food is also very good.

YhBigRwAFdRPIQxWDjZOrQ.text: I am having a tough time rating places, because when I am reading reviews I am looking for a place in the 4 to 5 stars range. However, when  I review I feel like 5 stars is the best EVER. I am changing, my 5 stars is now...I can not wait to go back! Harrie's is a perfect example.  The food was great, the service wonderful, the place was clean. The egg and sausage bagelwich is superb. My wife had the lox sandwich and while it was expensive, it took both of to finish it. We are already planning our next trip. Another, place that I am glad that it is not in my neighborhood, or I would eat there too much!

W_hlkb68lommmNbxl-MPtw.text: I am a sucker for a good bagel and after 4 days of convention food and all you can eat buffets, a simple, delicious breakfast was my desire.  It took me years to try this place.  Last year it was good and this year, again, it was a terrific break from the trade show grind, and just a half mile from the convention center.  In addition to the bagels, which were great, I tried the $10 Hoppel Poppel.  It's a mix of breakfast foods:  scrambled eggs, hash browns, salami, green peppers and onions.  The serving was gigantic and easily shared.    Harrie's Bagelmania is at the kind of off the strip, locally owned restaurants I love to find on trips to Vegas.

eZfVzXS5JYeiWTqwnbb9fw.text: Great lunch place ...I had the cup of Matzo Ball soup it was delicious..very hot with lots of celery and carrots....my friend and I shared the corned beef sandwich which also was very good...prices are reasonable. If you come at 1 o clock you beat the lunch crowd.

41pzOFRFzfU0D_xFaMnGLg.text: Frightening location and disturbing patrons can be a real put off but this throwback old school deli has the good stuff. Superb soups, shockingly good bagels and real deal meats and fish make up for the freakshow both inside and outside.

d8gFY4d_EBfmT6g8PtzO_g.text: Sadly, I never had an Elvis sighting here in my many jaunts to Vegas and breakfasts at this place. Great homemade bagels- I am partial to the everything bagel, which is dense and soft and fresh and crunchy on the outside. Coffee is okay and hash and eggs are standard...but you're really just here for the bagels (and the Elvis sighting) so it's all good. A great place for cheap weekend brunch.

PL_0ESC44WiAZavJ9UMT5Q.text: Loved this place!  Been to vegas for a conference and early morning was starving for some warm bagels and coffee. Harrie's Bagelmania was just the right place. Good location. Close to the strip. Cozy deli and warm service.   We had the Jalepeno bagel and french toast. Both arrived quickly and were delicious. I loved the fact that all their cream cheeses are lite. Our server was very warm and prompt.   The only negative was that the billing was very old fashioned. We had to give the lady our email address or phone number to get a copy of the receipt. Sort of dated that way. Other than that we had a wonderful experience and came back the next day for more :)

VHLGvMf2HH69Kyl_EYqOGA.text: Fun dive! Felt like we were in NYC. Would definitely return! The lady that runs the place is a little quirky... but, only interacted with her when we paid the bill.

Bz9dLbpfxpib2ISXduLlvw.text: Each time we come to Vegas, this is a must. Today I had the BLT on sesame bagel, excellent! They put so much bacon on it I couldn't keep it on the sandwich. The wife had their tuna on onion bagel, her moans of deliciousness was a testament to her enjoyment of the sandwich. She said it all when she stated-"everything looks so good, we need to come here every day. "

pmJOHHIcDjAp6kA0RdQrjQ.text: I am a regular and I have been a regular for at least 20 years (So, who's counting!)  This place is the mecca for a traditional nosh in Las Vegas.  The city's biggest movers and shakers have called this place home.  Burton Cohen was here every day for decades and I even found Siegfried having breakfast in the place.  Some things never change, such as, the grill is the size of a postage stamp.  I have felt sorry for the guys who have to work that grill and get the food out when the place is packed on the weekend.  So, don't be surprised that your eggs and potato pancakes might be a bit on the well done side because they've got that grill turned up too high.  The homemade soups are very good, as are the specials, cookies, fish etc.  However, the bagels and bialys are sublime!  I've eaten N.Y. bagels and I have bought bialys from Kossar's.  The Bagelmania bagels are just as good as the best N.Y. bagels, and Harrie's bialys are BETTER THAN KOSSAR'S!  There is no comparison.  So, if you want the best bagels in Las Vegas and the best bialys in the U.S., go to Harrie's.  The only reason I am giving them four not five stars is due to the grill being so darn small.  I loved Mort and when he died, his wife Nancy, who was never in the business, took over and I say, "Thank the Lord," or I might have died from a case of severe bialy withdrawals.
